1111.content:
Two years apart had changed the Straw Hat Pirates in many different ways. They were all stronger, their personalities growing along with their ability to fight for their dreams. Separated from each other every one of them had to learn a little about themselves as they trained themselves to get stronger. They became better people in some cases like Ussop gained more courage and Chopper gained more self-confidence. For Luffy however all that grew was his strength, he was still the exact same immature, idiot he was two years ago. Take for example what he was doing right now.

“Why do Nami and Robin have so much boring stuff?”

Luffy tossed a pair of Nami’s panties behind his back as he searched through her things. The crew had gotten back together on Sabaody Archipelago as planned, but before they began to the Fishman Island they stopped at a small island not too far to pick up some supplies for the journey. They had docked the ship behinds some rocks and after a game of straws, Luffy was selected to watch the ship. Left alone, the bored captain was going through everyone’s things like a bored five year old and was now going through the only female crewmember’s belongings. The simple fact that he was invading his friend’s privacy was lost on Luffy as was the entertainment value most men would get out of fondling girl’s underwear.

“Don’t Nami or Robin have any cool toys or something, they don’t even have any candy I can eat. I thought girls hid candy,” Luffy pouted as he emptied both girl’s belonging into a big pile. All he saw were clothes and other junk like books and map writing equipment. Luffy saw nothing that interested him and he was ready to leave, maybe go through Sanji’s stuff and see if he had any food stashed away, when he spotted something glittering in the pile of stuff. Luffy reached into the pile and pulled out a glistening amulet with a big red ruby in the middle. His eyes widened at the sight of the treasure. The two things Luffy loved most in life were adventure and food, but as a pirate, he was obligated to be fascinated by treasure.

Turning the amulet over in his hand, he stared at the strange inscription on the back in those weird words that Robin understood. The amulet probably belonged t her, but it could be Nami, it wasn’t that odd to find the orange haired thief with treasure. Didn’t matter too much to Luffy too much who it belonged to, it was a nice piece of treasure, probably worth a couple million berries. It was kind of surprising that whichever girl owned it hadn’t put it somewhere safer. They probably thought that no one in the crew would go through their things. Luffy was starting to wonder if looking through everything his friends owned was a mistake as he lifted the amulet up over his head to look at with better lighting.

CRACK!

“Oops,” was all Luffy could say when the amulet slipped from his rubber fingers and dropped to the floor. He wasn’t paying attention or he would have caught it, instead it landed on the floor, shattering like glass as it hit the wooden ground. Staring at the hundred broken pieces, Luffy’s face dropped as he realized how much trouble he was going to be in. If that was Nami she was going to kill him and if it was Robin well…Shudder….

“Maybe they won’t notice!” Luffy laughed as he turned away, missing the red mist coming from the broken amulet. He muttered to himself in a vain attempt to believe that the owner of the priceless looking treasure wouldn’t notice it missing as the mist surrounded him. When his body started to shudder, Luffy just put his hand over his stomach thinking it was his stomach rumbling for his next meal. Knowing there was nothing he could do, he tried to leave, not even bothering to hide the evidence. He started walking towards the door, but as he moved he found the door getting bigger and further away. Confused he walked faster, but the door continued to move back and get larger. Luffy ran towards the door as it got huge, looming hundreds of feet over him and a hundred times further away then he started. He had no clue what was happening until he looked around and saw everything else in the room just as big.

“Awesome! Franky got the Thousand Sunny to grow!”

Luffy attributed the sudden increase in the size of everything to the engineering skills of his shipwright. The fact that everything from Nami and Robin’s stuff to the dust mites under their beds were bigger were all ignored by Luffy who believed that Franky had somehow made it possible for the Thousand Sunny to become a hundred times bigger. With his eyes gleaming with excitement, Luffy was already trying to figure out how his crew was going to steer the giant ship when the ground began to shake. Luffy stumbled around as he looked for the cause of the trembling and found his answer as the door to the room swung open and a large boot stomped into the room.

Luffy had to crane his head way back, looking past a pair of breast that stuck out like two mountains. At first, he thought he was seeing a giant, maybe the biggest giant he had ever seen, but he recognized her and his immature mind slowly began to unravel the mystery of why everything was so much bigger. As he was figuring it out, the female was looking at the floor, but her eyes weren’t on Luffy. Instinctively, Luffy flinched at the sound of a loud, angry woman.

“My Amulet!”
1111.title: When Will Luffy Learn?

11111.content:
(This chapter was not written by me: but for personal reasons the author wishes to remain anonymous)

Nami walked in saw the pieces of the crimson jewelry scattered across the wooden floor of her room. Across it she found much of her belongings in a huge messy pile. She only knew one individual who was capable of doing this.

"Luffy!" Nami screamed as she clenched her fists in anger and slammed her foot on the ground. The vibrations caused Luffy to jolt up into the air briefly before landing back down on the ground with a thud. Although the sound was faint, she heard it. She scanned across the room, searching for the item that made the faint noise. She found the item and smiled in delight.

There was no mistaking the straw hat, red vest and blue jean shorts. At her feet, as small as can be, was Monkey D. Luffy; Captain of the Straw Hat Pirates. Luffy's and Nami's eyes made contact and there was an awkward silence before Luffy put his arm behind his bed and smiled nervously.

"Uh...hi, Nami."

"Luffy! Do you know the meaning of personal space? God, how many times have I told you don't go through my stuff! You've really done it this time, Luffy Do you know how much that amulet was worth? Well do you?!"

"Uh...five, maybe six thousand berries." Luffy joked.

"Are you joking!? It was worth four hundred million berries!"

"Like me!" Luffy said while pointing to himself.

"Yeah...like you..."

The gears turned in Nami's head as she formulated a plan. Luffy could only watch in utter as fear as he awaited Nami to express what idea the recess of her dark mind conjured up.

"Alright, Luffy. Since you broke something of mine that was worth four hundred million berries and you're worth four hundred million berries, I'll take you to as repayment."

"What! That's not fair!" Luffy protested.

Nami growled angrily. Luffy looked at the sheer size of Nami's body. It was huge. It had enough power to kill him a thousand times over without breaking a sweat. He had no choice, but to accept.

"Alright, fine." Luffy reluctantly pouted.

"Don't worry, Luffy. It will only be until you repay your debt to me. Now..."

113.title: Sanji

1131.content:
It was a sunny day at Amazon Lily, but no one was at the village. Rather every single female denizen was at the arena. There at the throne of the arena itself was the famous pirate empress and Shichibukai Boa Hancock with a look of disinterest. But even more curious still was how near her on what looked to be a make shift stone table stood a small figure. The figure was a man who wore black clothes. Specifically a black suit similar to a tuxedo complete with a tie. The man had blonde hair and had a most love struck expression on his face aimed at the pirate empress. His eyes turned into hearts for this man was Sanji of the Straw Hat pirates. Unlike other men Sanji did not care to know why he was small, all that mattered to him was being in the presence of an alluring woman. This in and of itself presented a problem for the female Shichibukai. Men are not allowed on Amazon Lily and all trespassing men are to be executed, that much was simple law of the island. However...

The index finger of Hancock's hand tapped on the arm of her throne. She lifted her finger slightly and swiftly lowered it making a loud clacking sound as her nail collided with the throne's arm all the while the amazons of the island silently waited for Boa's judgment of the miniature trespasser. She repeated this action many times in succession and mixed with the silence of the arena all were able to hear. She would like to painfully punish the shrunken male that stood on the stone table in front of her, but there's one problem. "This is impossible...!" thought a tense Hancock. Glaring down at Sanji who has not abandoned his love struck look the pirate empress continued to think in frustration "This man that stands before me is a complete Yes-Men. Nothing I threatened him with works. No matter how abusive, or painful or what I say I will subject him to, he finds himself enjoying every single possible threat or mode of execution. Violence is out. Turned to stone? He wanted to pose showing how devoted he is to all women and I can't forget that little incident..."

********************************
Sanji stood on the palm of Boa's hand who looked down on him as a lesser being. "For setting foot on this forbidden island you will suffer and die. And above all you will forgive me doing this to you because--" "You're BEAUTIFUL!!!" interrupted Sanji who yelled unusually loudly from the palm of Boa Hancock's hand. His words were loud enough that they even stunned Hancock herself stopping before she could complete her famous catch phrase. "He interrupted me and dared to state my line...!? This will not be tolerated. This man must pay the price!" thought Hancock. But little did she know at the time who she was dealing with.

********************************

"So then..." said Boa as she stood tall and cast a shadow down on Sanji's small frame. "Nothing I do seems to strike fear into you. Nothing causes you suffering. I threatened to rip off your head!" said Boa Hancock. "It would be an honor to bleed for you!" replied Sanji. "I threatened to feed you to my sisters in their snake forms!" "Nourishment for women is a good thing!" "I threatened to step on you!" "Anything to cushion you!" declared Sanji. A drop of sweat dripped down Boa Hancock's brow as the tension was on and with an audience watching to make sure she upholds the law of the island. "Is there something that you do not like about women!?" asked Boa in pure irritation. "I love everything about women!" said the small-scale cook. This only served to make Boa Hancock groan and fall back on her throne. "Impossible...just impossible...wait a second!" thought Boa as she raised a hand to her chin. The gears in the snake princess' head started turning as she looked down at the tiny infatuated cook who soon would no longer be smiling.

Sanji waited on the stone table. He saw Boa talk to one of her sisters by whispering something in her ear. All the while the foolish young man thought that with his chivalry he's won over the pirate empress and maybe even the hearts of every single amazon on the island. Nothing could have prepared him for what came next. One of Boa Hancock's sisters arrived and most unusually she brought a large square block of stone. Once Boa's sister left the scene, Boa herself grasped the block and hovered it over Sanji. Under the shadow of the square stone Sanji thought this was another test of sorts to prove his devotion to women and as a result wasn't bothered. Rather he announced loudly "Do what you must! I'll accept any punishment from a woman as delightful as you!" This only served to make Boa Hancock smile slightly. "I am glad you feel so accommodating about all this..." said Boa right before delivering the punchline "...because this stone used to be a man!"

"WHAT!?"

Was all that Sanji managed to say in a horrified tone of voice. For very soon Sanji felt nightmarish pressure on his skull as the stone block's surface began to crack the bones in Sanji's head. Fresh blood leaked from the crack in Sanji's skull dripping down into his eyes coloring his vision red. Not that his eyes would do him any good for within moments the stone continued to press down and finished shattering his cranium scattering even some brain matter mixed with the blood. Sanji's final thoughts consumed by the shock of being in some way suffering by the opposite of the object of his worship. The rest of his body gave way and was thoroughly crushed from the muscles, veins, and bones. The pirate empress lifted the stone and was pleased to see that all that remained of Sanji was a bloody stain with remnants of his crushed innards. She found the chink in Sanji's armor. If he worshiped women so much, then it goes without saying that its likely he doesn't have a good opinion of his fellow man. His tone of voice during his final word only served to confirm Hancock's suspicion.

A roar of cheering and applause followed as Boa Hancock finished upholding the law of Amazon Lily. The amazons seated around the arena were going wild with joy. The tiny trespasser was no more. Hancock raised her hands to get them to stop. Once they did, Boa only said one word:

"Dismissed."

Everyone started to exit the arena including the snake princess herself. All that remained there were the crushed remains of the Straw Hat's chef. A fate like this perhaps could have been avoided if Sanji wasn't such a simpleton when it came to women. In the end, this is what he gets for abandoning his dream of finding All Blue and choosing to become an even bigger skirt chaser over time. Rest in peace.

11531.content:
Aboard the Thousand Sunny, all was well. A bright and pure sun shone down upon the grand ship, it's occupants, the Strawhat Pirates, all were going about their daily business as they sailed on towards their next destination. One such member known as Tony Tony Chopper, their one and only doctor, was currently reclining in a swivel chair inside the Infirmary, his own mainstay room aboard the ship. The day had been slow, and the usual ruckus going on the upper decks seemed to have died down. Chopper let out a deep sigh, kicking his tiny hooves in the air as he spun in the chair. He was of a diminished stature, being the smallest member, but that didn't keep him from being just as able as any of the others. His soft brown fur rustled with his movement as he stopped the chair to gaze at a set of chemicals that sat opposite of him on another table. He had recently purchased it after Nami finally lent him some of her own coin, which had taken much begging and prying for the gold. He personally knew nothing about the sterile materials, as he had never encountered such supplies in his studies. Getting up out of the chair, he toddled over to the chemicals and picked up a beaker, the neon-green liquid inside smelling stark, forcing him to shove it away from his face and wrinkle his blue nose."This stuff reeks..."He said to himself, but still, he felt compelled to take another light whiff of the fluid. This time, it smelled a tad better."Hmm...."The doctor shrugged and once again, smelled the chemical. This time, even better than before. He giggled as he began to enter a state of light-headedness, breathing in the stench deeper and deeper. Soon, he was practically dizzy, swirling around on his feet and nigh toppling over, his laughter giddy and high pitched. Imminently, he fell on his back, the flask sent high into the air, only to land and shatter on Chopper's face, spraying the chemical onto his body and into his mouth. At first, he was alarmed, but the high of before had overtaken him, and he happily slurped the green off his fur."Tastes kind of like...cotton candy...."He mumbled before passing out, the world around him dissapearing into a duet of bleak darkness and pounding sounds.

When he awoke, a world of plum-color greeted him."Gaah?! Where am I?"He shouted, struggling to move, as it seems the new world liked to cling to him. After climbing out through a hole of light he spotted overhead, the reindeer breathed a sigh of relief. Gathering his senses, he collected what he knew of where he was now." The ship had dissapeared, so had his crewmates, the ocean had been replaced by a sea of fabric fibers, and he was naked. It didn't bother him since he was an animal, but the rest of the news of the situation bothered him."This is....weird."He stated the obvious, looking around for at least a landmark or something to help him. Of the landscape, only a few blurry images in the distance made sense. There were walls, sheer walls that escalated higher than the clouds, which oddly looked like grainy pigments of dust. Next to one of these walls, a mountain the same color of the fabric, looked like a hat.

With none of this information helping, Chopper sighed and entered his full reindeer form, an attribute granted to him by his devil fruit. He entered into a sprint, dashing across the landscape as fast as he could in hope of finding a place of refuge, or civilization, or something to help him.

There must have been giants living in the land, because after thirty minutes of running, earthquakes could be felt and booms could be heard, but in a rhythmic pattern, signaling that a large being was nearby."I hope they're friendly giants...."Chopper said to himself, worried about his last encounter with a giant, Oars. He recieved his answer only moments later, as a towering figure drew near, retaining a femine form, the shadowy outline fully filled into an extreme hourglass shape."Chopper? You in here?"The giantess called out a thunderous tone. It knew his name? The reindeer didn't recall if he had ever met a female giant before. The giantess came closer and closer, her feet large enough to crush the Thousand Sunny easily. She stopped right before him, bending down and looking curious. She was still too big for him to take in all the details and get an accurate view of what she looked like."What's his clothes doing here lying on the floor?"She said, picking up the mountain, revealing that it was a hat, his hat."I...was never that big!"Chopper stopped and reverted back to his human-deer form, his tiny stature gazing up in awe. With logic coming together, he finally realized what had happened, the chemical had shrunken him! And to an incredibly tiny size at that. But, who was this giantess towering so high above him?

"Err....hello?"Chopper called up.

"Hmm?"The giantess knelt down and peered even closer, her moon-like eyes looking down at the shorts curiously."There's a tiny ant in these pants...but you couldn't possibly have spoken...."

"I did! It's me, Chopper!"

"......Really?"

"I shrunk myself with uh....a chemical...on accident."He answered, rubbing the back of his neck in shame. Returning his eyes back to look at the giantess, he finally realized who it was.
11531.title: Chopper's Medical Mishap

Robin then walked over to the table where Chopper did all of his research, and sat down. Chopper explained what he thought might be able to reverse the effects, and Robin got to work, already knowing a little about medical techniques and ingredients from some of the books she had read.

About half an hour had passed, and Chopper started feeling very bored, as there wasn't much to do in Robins shirt pocket. "Robin?" He shouted up at her. "Could you set me on the table so I can see whats going on?" "Are you sure that's a good idea, since you're so small?" "Don't worry, I'll be careful." Robin smiled and set him on the table, then got back to work, becoming very absorbed almost immediately.

Chopper started observing the equipment around the table. "Wow, everything looks so strange from down here." He then walked over to the edge of the table, in front of Robin, and looks over the edge. And as he was doing so, Robin, still absorbed in her work, got up to get some ingredients on the other side of the room. When she did this, it knocked Chopper off balance, and he fell off of the table. As he was falling, the turned back into his reindeer form, as they had stronger legs. Chopper landed heavily, but still unharmed, on the chair. He turned back into his normal self, and fell over from shock and surprise. "I thought that was it for me." Then he heard footsteps to his right, and when he looked up, he saw Robin walking back to the table. "Oh good, Robin can help me get back up." But when she got close, she didn't slow down to pick him up from the chair, instead, she started to sit down. "AHHHHHH! ROBIN! I'M ON THE CHAIR!" But she didn't hear him, as she was to focused on making a cure. For him.

Chopper looked upward as Robin bent over to sit down, her skirt going up a enough to see the white panties underneath. "I can still get away if I start running now" Chopper said to himself as he started to sprint to the side of the chair.

Does he get away in time?
1153112.title: Robin

11531122.content:
Unlucky for the small reindeer, he didn’t reach the edge of the chair in time to avoid Robin sitting down. Chopper looked at the massive rear of Robin descending down above him until he was submerged under it. Chopper had expected that this was the end of the line and was surprised to see he wasn’t dead yet.

He was greatful that he wasn’t dead, something he couldn’t be happy about was his situation. The weight being asserted on him (especially in his small Brain Point form) was too much for him. To make sure he would last a bit longer, he transformed into his Heavy Point. All Chopper could say was that the weight wasn’t as hard as before.

For Chopper, it felt like an eternity had passed in reality it had only been two minutes. Robin was continuing her work on the cure had realized something was off, where was Chopper? She stood up to check the room. Once she stood up, Chopper took deep breaths. Chopper had never appreciated fresh air that much until this moment. After regathering his strength, Chopper stood up and saw Robin walking around the room. Chopper decided to stay in Heavy Point so Robin had a better chance of seeing him. Taking in one massive gulp of air, Chopper yelled from the top of his lungs.

“ROBIN!” Chopper had hoped that his voice had reached Robin.

Short, I know. Terrible, I know. I just wanted to help finish this story.

121222.title: Think

choices: The Marine Tashigi, who was tasked with transporting dangerous artifacts
Nico Robin, who'd heard of some ancient statues located on this ship
Boa Hancock, who returned to pick up a chest she left behind on an old ship.
1213.content:
Not paying any mind to what she grabbed, Nami reached for the smallest statue, barely even noticeable it was so small. It had to be less than an inch in height and was clearly worthless to the Navigator's sharp eye. Sure it was hand-carved, but there were no gems, no shine to it. The wood wasn't even all that great and it had the kind of design you could find in any market. A carving of a woman praying, real rare, if the buyer was a complete idiot. She sighed as it became clear she had gone to such lengths for nothing. The events of the entire day seemed to play back to show how this moment came to be.

-----

It was any other day for the Straw Hat pirates on their ship. Luffy was laughing and playing with Chopper and Usopp. Zoro was asleep in his room. Brooke was in his room playing some soft music as Franky worked on whatever invention he was at the time. While Nami sat in a bikini tanning with Robin, also in a bikini, who was entranced in her book. The ship's chef Sanji was busy making all sorts of delicacies in record time to try and woo the two women, but they barely paid him more than a word of thanks with each gift; neither interested in the man, but more than happy to take his gifts. A typical day, then the crew landed on the next island on their charts and the routine continued.

Trouble Island, an island known for (Go figure) causing Trouble. Though despite the name it appeared nice enough. What greeted the Straw Hats was a nice, large, clean white dock full of a number of ships. Each one a pirate vessel. The city that lay beyond a small grass field was full of pirates. Now it made sense where the island got its name. The Straw Hats docked at a free spot on the docks and began to get off the ship. Upon landing Robin quickly explained the basic formation of the island. The city itself was full of pirates and lawlessness, but rumors say that the Marines often operated in secret here. It was a prime information gathering place. In short, both Pirates and Marines were on this island. That was all that concerned the Straw Hats about this place.

Always eager for an adventure, Luffy dragged a few members of the crew to try and find something fun to do. After being forced to swear not to do anything stupid, Luffy led them out onto the island. After donning a short-sleeve dark blue shirt and a pair of light blue short shorts, Nami initially left the ship with them to try and use them for shopping purposes, but a large ship on the other end of the dock caught her eye.

In a pirate town it was surely a pirate ship, but there were no sales to identify it. In fact, other than its sheer size, the ship had no noticeable features at all. It was just a plain old wooden ship, just very large. Nami instantly liked what she was seeing with it. A ship that size had to hold an enormous crew, and the bigger the crew, the bigger the riches. The cheap-looking ship was probably something of a cover. The kind of cunning Nami had come to expect from pirates on the Grand Line. After playing a bit of a stealthy thief, meaning Nami walked onto the ship ready to bash someone in the head with her Clima-tact, the Navigator saw the ship was empty, save for one treasure chest. No doubt loaded with the rarest and most valuable of jewels and gems imaginable. Without missing a beat, Nami quickly began to drag the chest off of the ship. This was normally the kind of thing she'd get Sanji or Zoro to do; but…it was oddly light. She should have figured out what was wrong then. But no, the Navigator kept on dreaming of riches until she got off of the ship. There was still plenty of space left to drag the chest, but she couldn't resist taking a peek; so she opened it and, of course, inside were the three worthless wooden statues. One was about a foot tall, another was about half that, and the last one took a few minutes to notice it was so small.

Disappointment didn't even begin to describe how Nami felt.

-----

Almost ready to cry the Navigator opened her eyes to end the nightmare that led up to such disappointment. All she had were a few worthless, hand-made…Huh? Nami looked to her hand to see the small statue missing. Damn, did I drop it? God I'm starting to act like Luffy! Quickly the pirate knelt over to examine the ground for this lost statue, slowly getting frantic in her search for it. Moments later it clicked how foolish this was. Wait, why am I looking for that piece of junk? She laughed, Let the poor punks who own this ship look all over for it. Still, the red-head was stricken by a mild curiousity, Nami wanted to look back into the chest at the other statues. She stood back up to do so.

And realized she'd completely missed what had happened.

At first Nami thought she had wandered around absentmindedly while thinking but no, the chest was still there in front of her. There was just one problem. She couldn't reach into the chest; because she was smaller than the chest. Indeed, currently the treasure chest rose above the red-headed beauty like a mountain. Hell the grass was bigger than her! Awe left even the intelligent Nami dumbstruck for a moment. How did this happen? It was obvious that she shrunk…but when? When she was daydreaming over the day? That was the only possible time, but even though her eyes were closed…She didn't hear anything. She didn't feel anything. Her clothes still fit nicely. So she shrunk without feeling even the slightest thing? Well odder things happened on the Grand Line she supposed. But that still left the question of How.

Two possible answers came to mind. A Devil Fruit or the Statues. But Nami never heard of any shrinking Devil Fruits; then again she also didn't believe in them until she met Luffy. If it wasn't that it had to be the statue she picked up, which would explain why it was missing…But there was no way it could've done that. The things were worthless! And Nami was never wrong about treasure, nope, never…Okay maybe there was a slight chance…

"This is no time to be casting blame! I gotta get someone to help me before I get stepped on!" Nami screamed as her hands started to tug at her notable hair. Of course, easier said than done. There was no real way of telling how small Nami was, but if the grass was taller than her…she had to be under an inch at the very least. Maybe half of one. And she was by no means fast…or strong…or resourceful in wild environments. And the Thousand Sunny was a good half a mile away on the other side of the docks. The crowded docks full of giant people who could crush her like a bug. Not even getting into the fact that half a mile to Nami had to be…over a hundred times that long.

So…walk and more than likely get crushed…Or stay here and probably get eaten by a bug before the day is over…Where's Luffy when you need him? Heck, where's SOMEBODY who can help me when I need it?! Nami thought to herself, getting more and more frustrated with each passing moment.

It was ironic though, because right at that time…Someone had arrived.

BOOM!!

Caught entirely off guard, Nami fell flat on her face as the entire ground seemed to quake.

BOOM!!

Another quake, this one louder and stronger. Though this time Nami managed to avoid falling again and had started to rise. Weakly she got back on her feet.

BOOOOOOOM!!!!!

Not even two feet away, the gigantic foot wear of some giant-sized (normal-sized) person landed right before Nami, creating a quake strong enough to knock the poor girl flat on the ground again; as well as throw a nice hurricane of dust into her eyes, blinding her and ruining her outfit. Whoever this giant was, they spoke with a voice that was clearly feminine, even with the amplified sound.

"What's this chest doing out here?"

Slightly dizzy from just how loud this voice was, Nami looked up to try and identify the person who could help her. The sun seemed to hide behind their head, creating an outline and shading her face from view. This didn't help the fact that Nami could hardly see. But in no time at all any blur that Nami saw vanished as the woman's features cleared. Imagine her surprise when Nami realized she knew this woman!

Nami looked up to…

Robin's eye spots a familiar red speck beneath the sole of her heel.
121321.content:
Cautiously taking steps forward, Robin approached the treasure chest before the boat. This was definitely what she was looking for. A shoddy old ship with a "Cursed" treasure chest, exactly as she had heard.

Not even 30 minutes ago she was exploring the town, but before walking into the town the beauty changed into the outfit she wore in Skypiea, a sleeveless yellow shirt that exposed a nice bit of cleavage, a pair of purple pants that reached to her calves, a pair of purple high-heeled sandals, and what was something of a trademark for her, a white cowboy hat. All dressed and ready to go, Robin headed into town for a few minutes to gather information. Some of the information was useful, a lot of it wasn't. But there was one rumor that she kept hearing, and it piqued her interest. Something of a talk amongst the townspeople, there was a ship that was docked at shore. No one knew who the Captain was, or where they were, but after enough time the predictable happened. The ship was on a pirate island, pirates raided it. That's where the story grew bizarre, as no one saw any of those pirates again. Many rumors started, but people were still stupid enough to keep heading to the ship. It was through these various excursions everything was worked out. The ship itself was fine; the treasure however…Was not. Supposedly, inside were three statues, and anyone who touches a statue vanishes never to be seen again. No one knew how or why, but people began referring to the statues as cursed relics and warned anyone who came not to go near them. Anything relic-related instantly drew Robin's attention, so she kept asking about it. The story changed very little, but she did hear a couple of versions where people said that those who touched the statues didn't vanish, instead they were shrunken. Robin noted it but didn't take this alternated version seriously.

Now here she was, in front of the chest described to her. Though, she wasn't told it was in front of the ship, or open for that matter. It shouldn't have been open, no one other than Robin would've been foolish enough to go near the chest…Well, save for her crew. But they wouldn't pay any mind to such a cruddy ship. The only reason Robin was even there was curiosity and the idea these artifacts may hold some clues on the Lost Century or maybe even something else. Carefully she peeked into the chest, inside were the statues she was told about, but there were only two of them. There was brief urge to touch the wooden statues but Robin knew better than to follow that urge. She took a step backwards; Hmm…Everyone said three statues…Where could it be?

It was then something caught the brunette's eye, a small wooden statue in front of the chest, designed exactly like the others and about half of an inch tall. It didn't make it far from the chest, but it did make Robin realize something. Someone was here. Recently. But no one on the entire island was stupid enough to try and get these statues. Immediately Robin thought of her crew. Whenever something bad happened, or when a bad decision was made, it was their doing 100% of the time. Coincidence was possible she supposed, but Robin knew her crew well enough to know better than that. Besides, they were all with Luffy, who wouldn't pay any mind to the boat…Suddenly Robin remembered, Nami wasn't with them. She started with them, but later did her own thing. It was very possible she was involved in this somehow. It made sense, or at least…as much sense as anything in the Grand Line did. But that just left the question, if Nami really did come and grab the statue, where was Nami?

Maybe she really did vanish like the rumors said. I hope she didn't go in agony. Robin thought morbidly.

Nami didn't vanish, but she certainly in agony.

-----

"ROBIN! PLEASE! GET OFF OF ME!!" Nami cried against the sole of Robin's sandal. But any sound she attempted to make was muffled by the footwear, Robin had no idea she was standing on Nami. She couldn't even feel the red-head suffering underfoot. It almost made the girl want to cry that she was so small and unnoticeable.

Mere moments ago, Nami was standing; looking up at Robin, who was so tall she could've been a Goddess. No giant came near to her height, not even Oars. With Oars, Nami was about tall enough to be near his ankle. With Robin…Her big toe was taller than her. So yeah, Robin was pretty damn big, but still a friend. So Nami started shouting for her attention. Not even a minute after she started, Robin took a step towards the chest, and on Nami.

BOOM!!

Crushed into the ground was Nami, sore but more or less alive. Logically speaking she should have been crushed, but it appeared she a bit more endurable than that. Good to know, though it still hurt quite a bit. Nami was just thankful immediately afterwards Robin's foot came off as she took another booming step to stand before the chest. She was inspecting it very carefully, almost like she knew what would happen if she touched anything.

She probably does knowing Robin…Nami thought to herself past the grumbles of pain. Her body was in incredible pain, but it wasn't the worst she'd ever felt. Slowly the Navigator worked her way back to her weak, albeit she didn't look to be standing too strongly. Taking in a big breath, Nami readied for another shout.

BOOM!!!

…Only to be stepped on by Robin again. For whatever reason the giantess backed up and didn't move, leaving her foot on Nami. That was the current situation, little Nami was underneath Robin, in excruciating pain and failing to get any sort of attention from her. On the Brightside though, Nami didn't feel any bones cracking or anything like that. Apparently shrinking came with at least one perk, though if Robin stayed there for much longer, Nami would quickly learn to hate it.

Come on Robin, you're smart. If you know what these statues do you can help me. Nami started pleading in her mind, wanting help before she seriously got hurt.

-----

Robin decided to work off the assumption Nami wasn't dead and gone forever. But that still begged the question, where was Nami now then? It's possible she isn't here and never was…Though for some reason I feel that's wrong…But if she didn't vanish…As her mind racked itself to try and work things out, Robin recalled the aspect to this story she initially shrugged off. How the people didn't vanish, they were shrunken. If that was the case then Nami would most certainly be alive, but she'd be extremely small. Robin briefly looked at her surroundings. The boat was technically not at the dock, it was on the land beside the dock, which amounted to a grassy plain. Robin was standing in grass, which was all well in good, but if Nami was anything less than an inch tall she'd be completely invisible to her. The search would take hours…If it were anyone else. But Robin had her own tricks.

She closed her eyes as she raised her hands to opposite sides of her face, "Ojos Fleur…" Instantly, all over the entire grass field sprouted eyes, Robin's eyes, all looking for Nami in the midst of the grass. Robin had no proof that Nami was even shrunken, but she still felt as if she was on the right track. Her instincts tended to be right in situations like these. Though right now, no results. Still, she'd keep trying for a little while.

-----

Nami had given up preventing tears and was just doing her best to let it out with eating a face-full of dirt. Robin was still on top of her, thinking as hard as she could about the situation. In fact, she was thinking so hard, she probably didn't realize her foot was tapping. Normally something totally unnoticeable, when you are under that foot though, it's a hell that belongs in Impel Down. The booms that come each time Robin's foot touches the ground was deafening. The pain from being smashed between ground and sandal was building up to a point beyond Nami's pain tolerance level, in other words she was now screaming in pain. To make it even better, Nami was so smashed against Robin's foot that when it rose back up, she was still stuck to the sole! So when it came time to touch the ground again, it hurt even more. And to help top it off, the screams led to her face ingesting whatever it slams into, which is dirt in this case. After the first mouthful of dirt, Nami just started crying and felt herself giving up.

There's no way Robin will find me…I'm just a bug under her shoe right now…Nami had just about lost hope when she saw it, exactly thirty feet in front of her, Robin's eye! It was looking for her! Robin knew she was shrunken! There might be a chance yet!

The pain seemed to go away at this revelation; it suddenly didn't matter as Nami began shouting at the top of her lungs for Robin to see her, forgetting that it was Robin's eye and not her ear. "Robin!! Robin!! Down here Robin!!!"

------
Several minutes passed, at least ten, and the cycle hadn't changed at all. Robin was still tapping her foot without realizing it, and stuck to the bottom of her sole was Nami, who was barely visible from where she was. Nami was still doing her best to shout, but enough footfalls had left her voice raspier and less loud than it was before, and Robin was beginning to feel that her search was proving futile.

Then…
121321.title: Down Here Robin!

choices: In her sleep, Nami has some questionable dreams about Robin
Nami awakes to Robin casually reading in the Thousand Sunny
1213212.content:
The search was beginning to seem futile. Robin started to realize this as Nami, underfoot, long since lost hope. After all, how could she hope to be found if she spends half the time getting crushed under Robin’s feet? Robin was getting ready to retract her powers when it caught her glimpse, a small red speck on the bottom of her shoe. It appeared to be about the same size as the smallest statue but no other details could be determined. Robin removed the various eyes surveying the area as she lifted her foot. “I probably crushed her without realizing it, poor thing.” To Robin’s surprise, the speck on her shoe was still very much alive.

“Hey I’m still alive Robin!!” Nami shouted, it was meant to be a bit of a snarky response but in light of being found the red-head sounded more relieved than upset. With a simple pluck of the fingers Nami was removed from her hell and gently placed on Robin’s open palm. Nami instantly collapsed due to the unstable footing but was still too happy to care.

Robin offered a small smile of relief herself, “I’m glad you’re alive Nami, you had me worried.” As expected of the woman, she was quite considerate of Nami’s size and was whispering accordingly. “You should no better than to take random treasure like this.”

“Hey, I never thought it would do this to me!”

“Regardless, you’re usually smarter than that. I could’ve crushed you like a bug and have never known.”

Nami turned a bit green at the thought, “Please don’t bring that up, I don’t want to remember that ever again.”

Robin shrugged, “I suppose now isn’t the best time to talk anyway. We should focus on finding some means of reversing this.”

“Couldn’t agree more! Any ideas?”

“One, there was an elderly man in town who informed me about this chest. Perhaps he would know something about the actual shrinking process.” Nami offered a nod then wordlessly Robin began to bring her hand towards her cleavage, Nami instantly flipped out. “Woah woah woah! What’re you doing Robin?”

“I have to carry you in some way. This is the most efficient.” Robin stated matter-of-factly.

“No way! I am not hitching a ride between your boobs!”

“Why not?”

Nami lowered her head, “It makes my chest feel small…”

That comment even made Robin smile, “Right now all of you is small. Besides, you aren’t exactly in a position to argue.” Once again Robin moved her hand towards her chest, casually sliding the shrunken Nami in there despite all her protests. The redhead was held tightly within the confines of Robin’s cleavage with little room to move. “Sorry, but it’s more than likely you’d fall if I placed you anywhere else so this is simply the best option. Please just bear with it for a while.” And with that, Robin turned and headed back to town.

The bounce of Robin’s breasts with each step left Nami feeling a bit too woozy to reply.

All in all it was not a long walk. The old man Robin encountered was at one of the first bars upon entering the town, and he didn’t seem the type to leave the bar anytime soon. For Nami though, the short walk may as well have been an eternity. With each and every step Robin’s chest bounced, it was relatively mild but to one the size of a bug it was enough to turn you green in a few seconds. In a few minutes Nami wanted to vomit, the entire time feeling a bit of a shot at her pride for being small enough to have to ride in the cleavage of another woman. Nami found it hard to adjust to the notion that the two breasts on either side of her were both large enough to crush ten of her under a single mammary. It certainly made the redhead’s own voluptuous chest feel insignificant. Couple that with getting crushed under her friend’s foot and it was a miracle Nami hadn’t fainted yet. So it was only natural that once Robin took a seat across from the old man that Nami perked up, ready to hear it all.

The old man was as stereotypical as a pirate could get, he had messy hair, he didn’t seem to have bathed, several dozen bottles of beer were on the table, and he just gave the aura that he was a pirate. His hair was graying and he had a beard, worn clothes, he resembled either a pirate or the town drunkard…probably both. Despite all the liquor though he appeared completely tame. “You again eh Missy? Come to hear more of my “crazy” stories?”

Robin offered a polite smile, “Sort of. You mentioned with the chest earlier that you believed people shrank, not vanished.”

“They do! I seen it with my own eyes!”

“And I believe you, but what do you know about after that? Is there any way to reverse the process?”

The old man narrowed his eyes and took a sip of his drink, it seemed as if he understood instantly. “Well in a nutshell, I dunno. All I know are the details of the shrinking. Happened to a greedy buddy of mine, and I was there every step of the way.”

Robin’s brow twitched when the man said he didn’t know, and in her chest it was clear Nami was already shedding more hopeless tears. ‘Well could you tell me everything you know about the shrinking process?”

“Sure.” He took another sip, “See, they start off as small as the statue they grabbed, and that lasts about…a day or two. Then they get smaller…and smaller…until finally they just shrink into nothing. Whole thing takes about a month before they’re completely out of sight, it’s pretty slow.”

“I see, and?”

Yet another sip of his drink, “Well you seem invincible once shrunken. My friend, his wife accidentally ate him and a few days later he-“

“No need to go that far, thank you.”

“Sorry, anyway, they’re invincible. And they…well they get another problem. My friend…changed. After a day or two he just seemed like…Well like how all the fellas here seem to stare at you. He just seemed like he was turned on all the time, and nothing he did seemed to take it away. He started getting really desperate, and got crushed more than a few times because of it.”

Robin’s eyes narrowed, “You say he was just constantly full of lust?”

Surprisingly the man put his beer bottle down. “Yeah, got bad enough that in a day he was hitting on other guys. I told him to just do what all desperate guys do, but he told me that he tried- nothing. But it worked with his wife. So all I can figure is that he just couldn’t get rid of it himself, he needed someone else to basically make his day. Heheheh…Lucky punk…His wife was quite the looker…”

“Please focus.”

“Whoops, sorry. Like I was saying, his wife was able to help his problem a bit, but it came back in no time at all. He basically started needing constant attention until…You know, he just shrank away to nothing.”

“I’m sorry for your loss, but thank you for telling me.” Robin stood up and turned around.

“Hold it, let me say one more thing. Now this is just a theory of mine, but whenever my pal seemed uh…content, he didn’t seem to shrink. So I guess with this friend of yours, if you can keep em happy they probably won’t get much smaller.”

“…I’m sorry but you’re mistaken, I was just debating on touching it myself.”

“Uh huh…” The old man laughed, “I won’t pry too much, thanks for listening to my rambles a bit. Hope it all works out, you seem like a nice gal.”

Robin left wordlessly.

Once outside Robin found a nice spot alone and talked with Nami, now in her palm again. “It appears the situation is quite bad.”

Nami, who’d been increasingly upset over the entire discussion, now looked almost hopeless. “You’re telling me. I won’t only shrink into nothing, but I’m going to be miserably horny the whole time? I’m too pretty to go out like that!”

“I wonder about that last part…He had quite a bit to drink. It’s possible that part was wrong.”

Nami shrugged, “Doesn’t matter, I’ll still shrink to nothing.”

The giantess offered a consoling pet of her finger, “I’m sure we’ll figure out something. Later I’ll ask Chopper to take a look at you. But that may be a while, the crew could be anywhere right now.”

“I’ll be danged if I go out like that…None of those guys are my type. I’d sooner die than let them do that to me…”

It was clear Nami was obsessing on how she would be feeling during these final days. Either die hopelessly aroused, or lower her standards and essentially let someone please her. It was an impossible choice for someone as prideful as her. So Robin made the choice for her, “If that happens Nami I’ll handle it personally.” It was a very sweet thing to say, though what it implied was a bit head-turning.

Nami raised her head, “You’ll do what…? No way, No way! Nu-uh! NO!”

Robin smiled, “I said the same thing when you came for me at Enies Lobby. Yet now I thank you for it. As you will eventually thank me for this. I still owe you for helping save me after all, think of it as me repaying the favor.

Nami sighed, realizing it was probably her best bet, plus she was too tired to properly debate it. “I just wanna sleep for now…I’m exhausted from all this.”

In response Robin gently placed the woman back into her cleavage, “You can rest there. For now I still need to explore the area a bit. See if I can gather anymore information.”

“Sounds good to me…” Nami trailed off, slowly drifting to sleep. This time as Robin walked the bounces of her chest didn’t seem quite as bad, or maybe the exhaustion Nami felt was simply that extreme. Either way, in moments she was out cold.

121322.content:
Mixed feelings arose as Nami recognized her shipmate and near friend Nico Robin to be the giantess. On one hand, it was wonderful that it was not only a friend, but one who was both perfectly reasonable and kind. On the other…well she didn't exactly know Nami was where she was. A slight misstep and the brunette would crush the shrunken woman like a bug beneath her boot. And Nami was so small she probably wouldn't even feel the crack of her bones shattering…It made her shudder just to think about it. There was no time to waste; she needed to get Robin's attention before something bad happens, which, as she learned from being in this crew, wasn't going to take long.

"Robin! Down here! It's me Nami!" The red-head shouted at the top of her lungs and jumped to and fro. This end of the dock was near empty so there were no other sounds other than the ocean…but that was pretty much it. The ocean was loud enough to blot out anything Nami could've ever hoped to shout, though that didn't stop her from trying. Robin was observant. She'd notice something…she hoped.

"ROBIN!!!"

-----

Not so far away, the beauty that was Nico Robin casually strode towards the chest she had found in front of the ship she'd heard of in town. Like Nami, she too switched out of her bikini she was wearing on the Thousand Sunny and donned a more appropriate attire. This outfit was the same one she wore when she was in Enies Lobby, a leather one-piece outfit with some white frills on a the edges, that had a skirt that barely covered her hips and exposed a wide array of cleavage, matched by a pair of thigh-high black boots. A smile came upon her face as she found what she was looking for. Word back in the town was that this ship was carrying ancient artifacts from the Lost Century; which, if that were true, may hold clues towards the Poneglyphs. It wasn't particularly hard to find the ship without sails, nor was it hard to find the chest. It sat right in front of the ship after all. It was already open so Robin expected it to be empty, but as she got closer it became clear that inside were a couple of small statues, carved out of what had to be some ancient wood. Wiping her brow of some sweat before hand, the archaeologist knelt down to investigate, when something in front of the chest caught her eye.

"Hmm? What's that?" She reached down to pick up this small object in front of the chest.

-----

Nami'd been screaming for Robin's attention almost a straight three minutes now, and the giantess still showed no signs of having heard even the slightest of sounds. She seemed too focused on her thoughts and the chest's contents to really notice anything. But then Robin wiped some sweat from her forehead and began to bend over. This was great! Up close she had to be able to hear the shrunken pleas of her friend. Finding some inner strength at this, Nami raised her voice even higher and continued her shouts. And it might have worked. If not for something she didn't count on…

SPLASH

A huge bead of water the size of a bathtub suddenly landed on Nami, knocking the girl flat on her face again as its salty taste worked its way into her eyes and mouth. It was one of those things where you realize right away what had happened, and Nami hit herself for the lack of foresight. Robin wiped some sweat from her brow…obviously that sweat had to go somewhere. The water-soaked Nami realized that now. She stuck out her tongue and rubbed it to try and get the salty taste of Robin's sweat out of there, not even trying to think about the disgusting aspects of it. Unfortunately, this also doubled as a means of shutting Nami up. Her cries had stopped as she tried to work out this unexpected situation.

Right as this clicked in Nami's head her ears were once again deafened by the giant sounds Robin made. "Hmm? What's that?" Rubbing more sweat from her eyes, Nami began to cheer as she saw Robin reaching for….something else in front of the chest…Dammit.

What's a girl got to do to get noticed around here?! She stomped her foot as she began to fume. The red-head prepared to start shouting again…when she noticed what Robin had grabbed.

"Oh no…"

It was the same statue Nami grabbed, apparently dropped on the ground when she shrank. The statue that may have made her half of an inch tall.

"Robin! No!!!"

But it was too late; Robin already had her hands wrapped around the object as she brought it up to her face.

-----

Unaware of any impending danger, Robin carefully brought the small statue to her face to study it, using extra caution not to damage such a small carving. It was fascinating. It had nothing to do with Poneglyphs. But it was fascinating. Such a small piece of ancient art…half an inch tall…yet carved so well. The carving techniques resembled some of the techniques used in ancient Skypiean artifacts…though the wood was more akin to what could be found on the ground…It was reminiscent of the trees used in Amazon Lily. This could indicate the possibility the two had some sort of connection at some point, or that maybe they had a common link in their pasts. There were so many possibilities. But it was too early to say anything, this was all speculation based on how it looked. There'd need to be analysis on various things before anything conclusive could be done. If the chest was already outside the owners likely didn't want the statues anyway. After investigating the ship and any artifacts there, Robin would take the statues back and do some research with them later when she had free time.

Such was the plan, until the woman realized the statue the size of her fingernail was now the size of her finger. Her face hid any emotion but Robin was indeed surprised. Her eyes shifted to the chest, which originally came at knee level, but now sat right at Robin's stomach. The answer was very simple to come to.

"I'm shrinking." It was stated as fact, with no tone behind it at all. But Robin was indeed alarmed.

The process was happening so fast that in another couple seconds the statue became big enough to match Robin's hand, and it continued to seem to get bigger until finally Robin just placed it on the ground. No need for the artifact to suffer damage after all. She looked around for anyone who may have been able to help. No one in sight (Not that people in a pirate town would've helped anyway) But at the very least it made things simple to process. She was shrinking; there was no use to throw a fit about it. All Robin could do was wait until the whole process was done with and she could act.

Hmm…What if I shrink into nothing though? She thought morbidly. The chest was now as big as Robin was tall, and growing bigger with each millisecond. The final moments of the shrinking seemed to finish the process in one big burst. Robin was a foot tall now, but it seemed the moment she blinked, she was half that, and the next moment, half an inch tall.

Right as the process stopped, she was grabbed from behind. Instinctively Robin readied to attack. She turned her head to see her attacker, instead only seeing the nearly tearing eyes of her friend Nami.

"You shrunk too?" A moment later everything began to click, "…You were stealing the chest."

Nami nodded to both, "Yeah, I thought there was treasure. But instead I ended up like this! It's all that stupid statue's fault!"

"Indeed. I wonder how it did it."

"Who cares?!" Nami cried, "I just want to go back to normal!"

"You're right. But how should we do so?"

Nami released her friend, "Well, I hate to say it…But I think we need to find the guys for some help. It's either that or wait until someone comes and finds us."

Robin nodded, "I agree. Without anyone normal-sized we're quite helpless. Someone could step on us and mistake us for ants."

The mere thought was enough to make Nami depressed.

"I still have my Hana Hana No Mi powers though. That will surely prove useful. What about your weapon?"

Nami started laughing nervously, "I uh…left it on the ship."

"It's too big to use then. Regardless, we need a plan of action."

"I couldn't agree more."

After a bit of discussion, Robin and Nami decide to…
