Robin looked towards thier ship at the end of the docks, it was quite the journey but wasn't terribly inhabited most likely crews were in or on thier docked ships. The two could probably climb on board one of them and get help.

Robin looked at the nearby town, it was within a short jogging distance but was crowded with what looked like gods to the two shrunken women.

"Well whats the plan?" Nami said pushing Robin to choose faster.

Robin sighed at the smarter choice and said,
1213221.title: Which way?

choices: Gently scooped them into her hand (Kind and forgiving)
Picked up Robin but gave Nami a light flick of her finger (Grudge holding)
12132211.content:
Robin pointed to the docks in a calm and almost expressionless gesture.
"I think the docks would be a good idea, less chance of being squished." She declared, Nami nodded in agreement, at the moment she didn't know what to do. Robin began walking towards their ship with Nami tailing not far behind. Nami looked at the ground, she was able to make out cracks, holes, and crumbs of things that people normally couldn't see. It was like a whole new world that she stepped into, almost nothing was recognizable when she had walked down these docks earlier.
"Robin, what do we do if someone decides to walk in our general area, like, what do we do?" She asked tilting her head at the calm headed woman.
"We run, hide, move out of the way. Those seem like pretty good ideas." She replied without so much as even glancing at her. Nami sighed, that wasn't very reassuring to the girl.
"Yeah, I guess. So do yo think we'll ever get back to normal?" Nami asked trying to make the walk seem not as long and boring.
"I don't know..." Robin replied again in the same manner she had answered the other question. Nami frowned in disapproval.
"How are you calm about this? We're smaller than... alot of things! We could be crushed by the most insignificant object and you are still calm? If someone wanted to, they could crush us with thier pinky toe, with room to spare! Also a bird could pick us up, an insect could east us, a foot can-"
"Step on us." Robin said stopping and looking up into the sky.
"Yeah, exactly, now you get i-" Nami was cut mid sentence and was pulled by her bra strap, then two seconds later, a gigantic purple heel had stepped where Nami would have been standing. Nami was in awe of the monolicthic giant, that happened to be someone's footwear. She looked back at her savior, Robin smiled at Nami, knowing she was in her debt. Nami scuffed it off and looked away. "You didn't have to pull my strap so hard..." Nami mumbled, which was followed by a folding of her arms.
"Your welcome Nami..." Robin said with a slight grin.
" What is my chest doing out here?" A booming, godlike, but still feminine, voice asked no one in particular. Robin and Nami looked up, but that was much use, there was a set of planetary sized breats blocking the view of the woman.
"I wonder who that can be?" Robin asked Nami rubbing her chin in curiousity. Nami shrugged.
"It sounds like who ever it is, owns the chest..."
"Great, now I got speck sized idiot running around, and they had to grab the smallest one!" The monolithic being began to bend over and extend it's arm. Soon Robin and Nami were engulfed in an immense shadow that was the woman's hand. The hand gently plucked the small wooden statue up from the dock floors and dropped it carelessly back into the chest, which she then sealed shut with her other hand.
The shrunken duo now had a perfect view of the woman's face, and both had mixed opinions about the woman.
"Great, someone who could help us." Robin said with a smile on her face, Nami however wasn't so relieved.
"It's the love sick, I'm so pretty, amazon queen" She said with an annoyed tone. Robin looked towards her sternly.
"Wether you like it or not, she's our only hope." Nami stuck her tounge out at the black haired beauty.
"I wouldn't trust this love blinded idiot, even if she is the only one. She would probably hold us for ransom only to give us back for Luffy's hand in marrige. I don't trust the bitch queen!"
"Well that wasn't very kind of you speck girl..." The two looked back up at Hancock to see that she had crouched down and had listened to thier whole conversation. Boa then
12132211.title: Just three normal girls? (Merry christmass Lelouch

choices: Conis, the Angel Girl from Skypiea
1213222.content:
Instead of risking death by giant person. The duo decided it would be best to sit and wait for someone to come and get their attention. The boat had to have an owner. And the owner more than likely knew what the statues were capable of. If that's the case, then they would likely be able to get this persons attention. Nami only hoped that they would help.

Conveniently, after about ten minutes, someone arrived. A face neither Nami or Robin expected to ever see again. At least not so soon.

The one who'd arrived was...
1213222.title: Patience

choices: Having them underfoot works for now.
Start off easy. They can be her earrings.
12132222.content:
It was one face neither Robin or Nami ever expected to see again, especially so far in the Grand Line. Miss Valentine, still dressed in her bright yellow dress, yellow cap, yellow earrings in white heels while carrying a yellow umbrella, all of it save for the shoes and umbrella, decorated with various lemon themes. She didn't look any different than the last time Nami and Robin saw her, she still resembled a giant lemon. Except, this giant lemon was their enemy. A sadistic, giant, snobby, enemy.

Nami was essentially screaming her head off as Robin calmly eyed the coming giantess with slight nervous sweat. "What is she doing here?"

"Who cares?! This chick hates us and now she's big enough to crush us like bugs!"

"I think ants would be more appropriate."

"Not the point!"

--------

A good several miles away (To the shrunken duo) Miss Valentine stepped before the chest in front of the ship she was using. The chest wasn't where she left it…And it was open. The blonde frowned as she smelled a thief. But she knew one thing about those statues the thief sure didn't. A small smile formed on her face as she imagined how frantic they'd be after shrinking. Taking a few steps forward Miss Valentine casually peered into the chest, inside were the two bigger statues. Which meant the thief must've picked up the smallest one first. The grin the woman had grew even bigger. The smallest statue was exactly a half of an inch tall, with shrinking effects ranging from half an inch to a quarter of an inch. At that size, the thief couldn't have gotten too far. Looks like I'll get to handle them personally.

Taking a couple of steps back, Miss Valentine looked to the ground before the chest. Right beside it was the small statue that was almost stolen, and about a foot away from that…two shrunken people. The woman grinned as she raised a foot.

--------

The back and forth between Nami and Robin went on as Miss Valentine approached, mainly consisting of Nami screaming and panicking and Robin trying to figure out what to do. Neither of them had a proper plan of action as the white heels of the giantess loomed overhead. Nami's cries came to a screeching halt as a foot as big as a building was directly over her head, and coming down.

Robin was first to react, instinctively using her Hana Hana no mi powers to create several arms off of her main two, giving herself enough strength to fling just far enough away to be considered safe. Unfortunately, right as Robin landed she remembered Nami, and turned to see the girl too stunned to move. Miss Valentine's foot was less than ten feet away from her and seemed almost fifty feet wide, nothing could be done. All she could do was shout. "Nami!"

Nami, staring at the dirt and grime of Miss Valentine's shoe, seemed transfixed. Was she really about to die like the dirt under her foot? Would this be it? Robin's shout disrupted these thoughts as the red-head returned to reality. Nami turned to her friend just in time for Miss Valentine's foot to make contact with the ground.

BOOM!!

That had enough force to crush Nami in an instant, but it seemed she had luck on her side. Miss Valentine's heel's sole touched the ground, as did the heel itself, but the space in between was completely empty, and in that space, was Nami. The casual footstep of the giantess made a hurricane of dirt and dust that further messed up the treasure hunter's appearance. The next second the smoke cleared, and out of it came Nami, running into Robin's relieved grasp.

"You had me worried there."

"You're telling me!?"

The happy moment was short-lived as the duo looked back to Miss Valentine, who was now peering into the treasure chest. Just peering, not picking up anything. Almost like she knew what would happen if she did…

"Hey Robin…" Nami began, "What do you think are the odds this ship and chest belong to her?"

Robin thought for a moment, "Considering she hasn't made the same mistake we made, I'd say rather high."

Right as Robin said this; Miss Valentine backtracked three steps and looked to the ground. At that moment it was very obvious she knew. The next instant, her eyes locked onto the two girls and her right foot rose high into the air as she smiled maliciously.

"This is what I do to little Ants that try to take my stuff."

In less than a second she stomped the two as hard as she could.

--------

Miss Valentine laughed out her signature laugh as she twisted her heel into the dirt to grind the thieves as best she could. "Kyahahahaha! How's that feel you little pests?" She removed her foot from the ground to look at them. Both were still alive. With her Kilo Kilo no Mi abilities Miss Valentine reduced her weight to a mere 10 Kilograms. It was a weight perfect for stomping shrunken people, because it still hurt like hell, but it didn't kill them.

"Bet you're surprised to be alive huh? You can thank the Kilo Kilo no Mi for that. Though by the time I'm done, I doubt you'll be thankful." The evil smile the blonde had only grew worse.

"Before I start though I want to see what you two look like. From up here I can't see anything but two dots." Slowly the woman bent over to get a better look.

--------

It felt as if someone like Luffy punched both Nami and Robin. It carried almost superhuman force, but it wasn't enough to kill the two in a single shot. Granted, a few bones were likely cracked, and both of them were embedded into the dirt, deep enough in it they couldn't move and were helpless. From the ground they grunted and moaned in pain and slowly opened their eyes to the looming form of Miss Valentine, who was honestly too tall to fully comprehend. She looked almost…three times bigger than Oars at least. With legs tall enough to be considered mountains and a chest that made Nami feel so inadequate. Hers were bigger, but at the moment, not anymore.

"Bet you're surprised to be alive huh? You can thank the Kilo Kilo no Mi for that. Though by the time I'm done, I doubt you'll be thankful. Before I start though I want to see what you two look like. From up here I can't see anything but two dots."

Miss Valentine knelt down so that her head was more visible. Up close recognition shined in her giant eyes as she saw the two familiar forms that were Nami and Robin. At first she looked surprised, but that look changed almost instantly to another grin, one much scarier than the last one.

--------

This was too perfect. Nami, member of the Straw Hats who humiliated Miss Valentine and took down Baroque Works, and Nico Robin, traitor to Baroque Works. The two women Miss Valentine couldn't stand the most, and now they were a quarter of an inch tall. At her mercy. "Well well well, What do you know? Funny running into you here little ones."

In the ground it was clear Nami was getting increasingly fearful, Robin however, remained stoic. Though she also had to be nervous. "I bet you two are wondering why I'm here too. So far out in the Grandline. Do you want to know why?" The smile turned to a frown instantly, "Because of you bastards!!" Her voice carried enough wind to blow a gust into the duo's faces. Miss Valentine's expression returned to normal after a quick breath.

"After the whole thing at Alabasta Baroque Works went down, and with it, my money; so guess what I had to do? Face the real world as an outlaw. For what? We were told we were making a better world. I had to do a lot of sneaking around and after a while, I thought I managed to get my dream job as a Chocolate Lady. But guess how that lasted? It didn't!" In about a month the Marines came knocking on our doors, and I had to take off running again! Now look at me, I'm doing whatever I can to earn some money. Like, for example, delivering dangerous artifacts in a cruddy boat." Miss Valentine shuffled her foot so that it was hovering over the shrunken duo embedded in the dirt. "I've hit rock bottom, and it's all because of you and your stupid crew!" With the foot she had over them Miss Valentine stomped them again.

From the dirt came Nami's voice shouting a question. "What did we do?!"

Miss Valentine frowned, "Yeah, Baroque Works turned out to be a pretty bad organization. Sure, Crocodile lied and used all of us. But guess what? It was a hell of a job and it paid well!"

"Crocodile was only using you!" This time it was Robin.

Miss Valentine responded with another stomp, "Like I care. Listen, the world could rot for all I care. So long as I have my own little life of luxury I couldn't care less what happens to anyone else." A moment passed and Miss Valentine went on, "You took away my luxurious life so you two are going to do your best to give me one to make up for it. You got it?"

Neither Nami or Robin replied, largely because they didn't know exactly what they could say. The giant fingers of Miss Valentine plucked them from the ground and held them in front of her face. "From now on, you two are my personal little slaves! Kyahahaha!"

How shall Miss Valentine introduce her two slaves to their lives?
12132222.title: The Sadistic Lemon

choices: Nami is to be dealt with
121322222.content:
It didn't take long for Miss Valentine to make use of the two Straw Hat women. Currently they are stuck hanging on to Miss Valentine's lemon shaped earrings. Robin and Nami were on separate earrings holding on to dear life as Miss Valentine made herself light as a feather to glide through the air and head towards her boat that acts as her home. A boat that has served her well since her Chocolate Lady business was busted by the Marines. Swiftly Miss Valentine increased her weight and started to fall. The cold wind passing through the shrunken frames of Nami and Robin was such that they closed their eyes as Miss Valentine was speedily descending. They didn't even notice Miss Valentine enter her boat home and only opened their eyes when they both felt Miss Valentine's hands pluck them from her earrings and placing them on a white surface.

The female duo looked around and saw that they were on a kitchen counter. Next to them was a bowl of chocolate pudding that shone with the light above and looking delicious. But rather than focusing on the dessert Nami and Robin continued to look around and saw that for all intents and purposes they were in a normal kitchen with a refrigerator, a kitchen sink, oven etc. Their attention was drawn yet again to the woman that held them hostage who proceeded to announce:

"Welcome to my humble abode!"

Oddly enough, as soon as Miss Valentine said this she took a step to the side to be in front of the bowl of chocolate pudding she had prepared prior to finding the two shrunken women. That delectable piece of goodness that she made reminded her of her dream. The dream that seemed like it was coming true, but was shot down thanks to misfortune. Miss Valentine had her hopes ruined and turning to the side so that Nami and Robin don't see it she shut her eyes and put on a pained expression, though she dared not to cry as she's not the type to show weakness. "I'm going to make them pay...!" thought the former employee of Baroque Works.

"Right..."

Said Miss Valentine as she faced Nami and Robin. "Its time for you to start paying me back for costing me everything including my dream. I'm going to work you two like dogs!" said Miss Valentine "How about we start with-" "Never!" shouted the hot headed red head. Nami had no patience for nonsense and there's no way she's going to be reduced to being someone else's slave. Nami has always been a bit on the proud side. Robin on the other hand knew first hand just how sadistic Miss Valentine was due to them working in the same organization in the past. "Nami hush...!" Robin tried to say, but Nami didn't stop. The short tempered navigator opened her mouth to say "I don't care about what you want or your failed dream! I'd rather perish than be subjected to your whims!"

Hearing such offensive words aimed at her failed dream was the straw the broke the camel's back. Forming a fist Miss Valentine slammed it with intense ferocity on the kitchen counter.

BAM!

Came the loud sound with a shaking side effect after the impact. Both Nami and Robin lost their footing and fell to their knees. "How dare you..." came a notably bitter Miss Valentine. Robin immediately stood and understanding just how grave the situation was pleaded "She doesn't mean it! Give her another--" "Quiet!" ordered Miss Valentine. If looks could kill, then anyone who came into Miss Valentine's sights would be nothing more than a corpse for nothing compared to the look of pure concentrated vitriol that she had at the moment. This rebellious young woman has overstepped her boundaries and now she's going to be judged harshly for it. On the other hand if Nami lost her life, Miss Valentine would be short one slave and she'd be taking the easy way out, what will the sadistic lemon themed woman do?
121322222.title: The Chocolatier's Servants

1213222222.content:
Her dream being insulted was an offense far too emotionally hurtful to bear. Concentrating her gaze on Nami Ms. Valentine pulled a surprise move when she shot her gloved hand towards Robin. Once Robin was engulfed in Ms. Valentine's hand, the sadistic blonde giantess lowered Robin to the floor of her home. "I need to restrain the one that has a Devil Fruit." thought the sadistic woman. Once placed face up on the floor Robin felt a shadow above her. Before she could react she felt it.

Boom!

The sole of the white heel fell on Robin. It covered most of her body except from her chest all the way to her head. Her arms were unfortunately pinned and being crushed painfully under the sole of Ms Valentine's high heel. "She targeted me knowing I'd be the one who can put up the most resistan--" "AHH!" gasped Robin as she felt Ms. Valentine send a wave of pain by firmly planting her heel on her tiny form. "Robin!" exclaimed a worried Nami. Before she could make another move she found herself painfully grasped and squeezed into Ms Valentine's gloved hand. "Agh!" coughed Nami struggling to breathe and unable to struggle as Ms. Valentine wasn't going to allow her to do a single thing. Nami could feel her very own breasts painfully pressing inward into her lungs. No doubt they will be sore.

Below Nami heard a scraping sound. Struggling to turn her neck she saw the bowl of chocolate pudding. Getting a rough idea of what Ms. Valentine planned to do Nami was struck by a twinge of fear for her own life. "No!..No!" thought the desperate young woman who opened her mouth to scream "N-" only to have her words be muffled as her shirt covered her mouth and was in the process of being removed. Taking advantage of the shock Nami received Ms. Valentine eased her grip ever so slightly to allow her free hand to start removing Nami's shirt. It was over in an instant for Nami was left with her breasts exposed. As Nami suspected earlier being squeezed with such intensity did leave her breasts with purple marks and sore spots. A slight chill overtook her body, but Ms. Valentine was far from done as she used excessive force on Nami's pants and within moments.

RIP!

Nami's pants were ripped directly from her. Ms Valentine immediately dropped Nami's clothes to the ground where Robin managed to see. Not wanting to imagine what Ms. Valentine had planned for Nami, Robin closes her eyes as the heel's sole continued to keep her firmly in place on the floor. "Please stop!" begged Nami who was now hanging by her strained arm that was being held between the cruel giantess' thumb and index finger. Ignoring her pleas Ms. Valentine smiled with glee and said:

"I take my job as a Chocolate Lady very seriously. After all it was my passion, but what am I saying? You be the judge."

Nami was mercilessly dunked into the chocolate pudding as soon as Ms. Valentine finished talking. She was fully submerged into the gooey substance that was sticking to her naked body. The layers of chocolate pudding were warm and soft. Even though her life was in danger, Nami couldn't help but wonder if this chocolate dish was freshly made. Nami felt herself rising and was soon enough pulled out of the bowl. Once out Nami gasped and coughed trying her best to get some fresh air, but all she could get was air that was scented with the smell of chocolate due to how her body is covered in the stuff. Soon, Nami heard Ms. Valentine say:

"How disappointing, you were holding your breath. Well don't you dare worry, that can be fixed..."

Right before re-inserting Nami into the bowl. This time Ms.Valentine made sure to tease Nami's very lungs by leaving her eyes above the surface of the chocolate pudding while her nose and mouth were without a doubt completely enveloped in chocolate. Nami tried just as before to hold her breath, but with Ms. Valentine now fully aware of her tactic, there was no fooling her. It didn't take long for Nami's lungs to start aching and her head to start to feel lightheaded. She needed air! But with no way to breathe fresh air Nami gave up and opened her mouth only to be filled with the chocolate substance that surrounded her. The ecstatic taste of cocoa beans invaded her nostrils and assaulted Nami's shrunken taste buds. Even she had to admit that Ms. Valentine produced quality chocolate dishes, but taste aside she seriously needed to draw breath before she suffocates. So she started to shake her head in an agitated manner. Luck was on her side as she was raised up high in front of Ms. Valentine's sharp eyes.

Ms. Valentine studied her handiwork and saw the poor young woman she submerged into the chocolate pudding. Nami was convulsing wildly as she hung from her strained arm, desperately trying to get some air into her lungs. Ms. Valentine's free hand came near Nami's face. Her free hand's index and thumb pinched her cheeks forcing Nami to open her mouth. With that Ms. Valentine took a look inside Nami's mouth. Even though she was a shrunk, Ms. Valentine could see the inside of Nami's cheeks and just as planned they were filled with chocolate pudding. "No doubt, she has tasted my work..." thought the giantess. Retracting her fingers from Nami's mouth and putting a bit of distance between herself and the hand that held Nami in front of her, Ms. Valentine asked in a stern tone of voice:

"Well, how would you rate that chocolate pudding?"

Nami's throat was full of chocolate that she was desperately trying to cough out. Swallowing some and coughing out the rest, Nami was finally able to breathe normally. Never in her worst nightmares did she expect to put through something like this. She heard Ms. Valentine the first time and not wanting to risk angering her, Nami opened her mouth and said what she felt when her taste buds collided with the dessert "The chocolate dish you made...it was good. No. It was very good!"

Not detecting any tone of a lie, Ms. Valentine showed a dominant smile. She knew that she's gotten through to Nami on some level. However, new thoughts have begun to enter the lemon dressed woman's mind. This short tempered red head has given her some trouble. And she is covered in delicious chocolate pudding, enough so to be bite sized snack. "Should I forgive her? Or should I dispose of her?" thought Ms. Valentine...
1213222222.title: Nami the Critic

12132222221.content:
Ms. Valentine's dominant smile never left her lips. Not only has she gotten her ego stroked by her enemy, but her new intentions have made her mouth smile in such a way that she shows off her teeth to the shrunken woman. Once Nami caught sight of Ms. Valentine's teeth she had to admit that at her size she felt a tad intimidated, but what started as a little intimidation started to grow into outright fear as she saw Ms. Valentine slowly hovering Nami towards her mouth which was simultaneously opening directly in front of the Straw Hat's navigator. "W-What are you doing!? Please stop!" yelled Nami as she tried to swing back and forth from her strained arm which has grown numb from the long periods of holding Nami's weight. Ms. Valentine momentarily closed her mouth and said:

"Just because you praised my work doesn't mean I ever had any intention of sparing you, kyahahaha!"

Ms. Valentine ended her statement with her famous laugh. The breath and intensity of her voice was overwhelming for Nami given how close she was to Ms. Valentine's mouth. She felt both the warmth and deafening sound coming out of the giantess' mouth, but that was the least of her worries. "She wants to eat me!" thought Nami. Before she knew it she had a very clear view of Ms. Valentine's mouth. The fangs, the molars, the frontal teeth, the tongue, the saliva, the uvula, and of course the pit where Ms. Valentine intended to pass her through to fall into her stomach.

Ms. Valentine stuck out her tongue and aimed it at Nami's chocolate pudding covered stomach. The tip of Ms. Valentine's tongue hit Nami's stomach. The cooling saliva created a slightly ticklish sensation for the poor red head. From there Ms. Valentine started to clean Nami's front by licking upwards "Hahahaha!" escaped Nami's lips against her will for she fully realizes her current dilemma and the dangers that it entails. "Quit laughing! You're on the verge of being devoured!" was all that Nami managed to think to console herself. After Miss Valentine finished her licking motion, the front of Nami's body from her stomach all the way to her face was clean.

"Tasty!"

She heard Ms. Valentine say as she began to position Nami into entering her mouth head first into a horizontal position. She did her best to keep Nami's body straight so that she couldn't move even though the shrunken woman tried as hard as she could to squirm her way out of her predicament. "I'd rather fall to my death than act as nourishment to this piece of garbage of a lowlife!" But all her struggling came to a halt when she saw her head inside the dark cavern that was Ms. Valentine's mouth. "Why is it so dark?" asked Nami only to spot that Ms. Valentine has lowered the upper row of her teeth and now that Nami's head was inside the true horror began when she felt an unspeakably painful sensation cut into her spine just below her head.

"AAAHHHH!!!"

Nami let out a blood-curdling scream. Her body however failed to respond and unfortunately for Nami she quickly figured out why that is. Ms. Valentine used the upper row of her frontal teeth and brought them down directly on Nami's neck. With the damage done to her spine, Ms. Valentine has effectively left Nami paralyzed from the neck down. Nami couldn't feel it and her eyes were getting heavy, but she knew she was probably bleeding. Not that Ms. Valentine would let Nami die of blood loss. No, that evil bitch wanted her to die within her. It wasn't enough for her to be shrunk, she wanted to really inflict terror into Nami and being eaten while paralyzed is without a doubt a frightening fate. "Crocodile...knew...how to pick them..." those were Nami's last thoughts before she decided it was better to give up than struggle to stay conscious but paralyzed inside the villainess' stomach.

The blood that came from Nami's deadly wound dripped down to the floor where Robin was. Hearing the sound of the drops made Robin open her eyes. Looking upward she saw more drops falling but what scarred her was the sight she saw. The image of Ms. Valentine inserting Nami's bloodied body covered in chocolate into her mouth and loudly swallowing will stay with her til the end of her days. Robin's eyes started to burn and soon enough they grew moist. She started to sob and her nose started to feel wet. It didn't take long for Robin to uncontrollably cry for her friend.

GULP

Came the sound from Ms. Valentine's throat. Nami was no more. Needless to say what Robin just saw served as a warning. If she ever gives Ms. Valentine any reason to kill her, Ms. Valentine will not hesitate. Robin never saw her friends the other Straw Hat pirates again who wondered where their two female companions disappeared to. Poor Robin was left being an eternal slave to this malevolent giantess.
12132222221.title: Choco Navigator

choices: Hancock heads back to her ship to test out her new slave.
On the way to her ship Hancock runs into a familiar face
12133.content:
Slowly the light began to dim around the giantess, revealing her. Nami's eyes traced up starting with a pair of towering purple heels that led up to flawlessly sculpted bare legs that tied into a purple dress cut at the hips. Further up were a pair of enormous breasts that blocked a majority of the woman's face. From what little she saw of the face, Nami saw a pair of beautiful, yet extremely angry eyes and long, flowing black hair. Even with her new perceptions of the world the navigator was aware she was looking at a goddess of beauty, and there was only one woman this beautiful in all of the sea. The luscious and temperamental Boa Hancock. Nami had always heard stories of the woman's beauty and even saw a few pictures. But they undersold Hancock's divine presence. Even Nami, who almost never felt inferior to someone in terms of looks, felt like a mere bug before her. It didn't help Hancock was so massive by comparison she literally cast a shadow for miles from Nami's perspective, the redhead's beauty was quite literally overshadowed by the mere presence of the giant woman.

-----

As Nami felt her self-views crumble away, Hancock meanwhile investigated the contents of the abandoned chest. This raggedy ship nearby was the result of the latest attack by the Kuja pirates. Not even a day ago it was full to the brim with treasures and crew members. Then the Kuja came and attacked and plundered. Though ironically the plunder was too much, and after leaving the male scum of the crew behind at sea they were forced to take the ship to the nearest island to try and unload some of the goods. Hancock didn't like the idea of having to deal with more of the annoyances around her but there was little choice. It was a solid job though so the Pirate Empress allowed her crew to spend the night having their fun, meanwhile Hancock took an interest in what the crew considered their greatest treasure. At a mere glance they were three small wooden statues, but in reality they were an experiment done by the scientist Vegapunk. Blessing the objects with the powers of a Devil Fruit. She didn't know the name of the fruit, but it's power was to shrink anyone. As a result, any who came in contact with the statues would shrink to roughly the same height as them. It was an unexpected find for a group of rabble pirates, especially considering how informed they were of it.

But that was all a moot point now, they now belonged to Hancock. And she took a special interest in them. The statues were a perfect way to handle anyone who annoyed her. Plus on top of that, they could be used as servants after that. After all, if anyone deserved shrunken servants it would be her would it not? Only the most beautiful get the best things. Therefore Hancock deserved it. Unfortunately her crew didn't seem to get that and left the chest in the ruddy ship they decided to abandon. After chewing her idiots of a crew out Hancock was forced to retrieve it. But that begged the question; Why was this chest out in the open?

"So help me if anyone stole them I will-" Hancock stopped as she spotted a small figure in the dirt. It was the smallest of the statues, which meant...Hancock bent over and looked around. And there it was, right beside her feet- a shrunken person. The woman couldn't suppress her smile as she plucked the person from her feet and held her in her palm. "Why hello there little one."

-----

Nami shrieked when the gigantic hand of Hancock reached for her. It was unlike anything she'd ever encountered, each finger was bigger than the Thousand Sunny! But she didn't fight it, not that she could, and soon she was lifted hundreds upon hundreds of feet into the air. Honestly, Nami swore her ears popped several times in the span of a single second. Before she knew it the fingers deposited Nami onto a massive palm and she stared into the looming beauty that was Boa Hancock's face. Nami felt insignificant before the giantess. When she was greeted Nami cautiously waved a hand, "Hi Misses Hancock."

Hancock seemed to find the formalities amusing, "Ah, so you know who I am? Hard not to I suppose. I take it you touched my statues?"

If Nami was nervous before she was downright scared now. She tried to steal from the moodiest woman in the sea...This didn't bode well. She quickly bowed to Hancock's face, "I'm so sorry I had no idea!"

"It's good to know that you realize your situation. Very rarely does someone cross me and live you know. However I am feeling a bit merciful."

The little woman raised her head with a relieved smile, "Really?! Oh thank you! Thank y-"

"-After all, you will make an excellent servant."

A nervous chuckle escaped the navigator's lips, "I'm sorry, I must have misheard you. Servant?"

Hancock's smile turned to a frown, "You didn't mishear me. Because you tried to steal my belongings you shall henceforth become my shrunken slave."

"Bu-"

"Silence!" Hancock yelled, "You should be honored to be my slave, after all...I am beautiful!" The amazon queen winked at her slave and Nami had to admit, she felt herself briefly swoon. But the dire situation made her stop quick. "But I'm a pirate, I have a crew and everything!"

"Not anymore. From now on you're my property like these statues. If you have a problem with that..." Hancock's fist clenched tightly and Nami felt pressure from all possible directions, "I am sure I can figure out something else for you." Her hand opened again, "Do you understand?"

Nami had been in situations where she had to bow her head and say yes before, but for whatever reason she did something else. "Luffy will save me!"

As Nami said that Hancock's expression changed, "Luffy? You know Luffy?!"

The sudden mood swing was jarring, but Nami suddenly remembered. Luffy met Hancock before! He mentioned it when they reunited at the Sabaody Archipelago. Maybe her statement just saved her life. "Yeah, I'm his navigator. The name's Nami."

Hancock's eyes changed, clearly recognizing the name. "Nami...?" The redhead nodded, "Nami..." Hancock's tone seemed to change, "Nami!!!" Suddenly her fist clenched again, crushing the redhead in her grasp, "You're one of those worthless women trying to steal my husband then?!"

Steal? Husband? What? None of what Hancock was saying made sense to the Navigator. But it was clear things didn't go quite as she wanted. Hancock gritted her teeth and clenched her hand as hard as she could for several minutes before finally beginning to calm down. Her hand opened to reveal Nami, gasping for air and red all over. "I should just kill you for getting between me and my love. But since you're small anyway I think I'll just stick to keeping you as a slave. But more on that later, I've wasted enough time as is." Before Nami could respond Hancock pulled her dress back and shoved the little redhead into her cleavage before sealing her dress back. Hancock's cheeks tinged with red, One of my rivals in love is now my slave. And I know you're nearby now Luffy...The thoughts began to trigger a number of fantasies. But the sight of the chest quickly reminded Hancock, "Oh yeah..." Using her dress to cover her hand Hancock lifted the statue in the dirt and placed it back in the chest.

She wasn't going to drag this big, mostly empty chest back to her ship. She was too beautiful for that. So instead she went for the next best thing. That's why without warning Hancock kicked the chest in the direction she knew her ship to be. Offhand she knew the distance and direction and with the proper amount of power she used it probably landed on her ship by the time she started walking, back to having fantasies about her husband-to-be.

1312.content:
"Finally !", said Nami out loud, "An island of the New World where the entire island doesn't want us dead ! I mean, I expected everything to be hard once we got out of Fishman Island, but I couldn't have one second to breathe, on or off the ship ! Oh well, the others are out buying books, ship parts, and whatnot, so time to make buisness."

After managing to get 3 bags of clothes for less than 500 berries, she came across a mysterious old stand with an old lady guarding it.

"Halt, young lady !" said the shop owner, stopping Nami in her tracks. "I see many things going in your heart. Kindness, loyalty, and the will to help your friends. But all of that, is being corrupted by a greed you should have stopped having a long time ago. But with this item- HEY !"

Nami, who was already walking away, turned back.

"I'M TRYING TO GET YOU AN ITEM THAT WILL MAKE YOU MORE USEFUL TO YOUR TEAM !!!"

"Is it free ?" said Nami with wide eyes.

"Greed will not make you prevail, young lady", said the owner, but she saw Nami pout, and sighed. "But yes, it is free."

"Deal !", said the enthusiastic Nami. The owner then took out a gold necklace, with the shape of a tiny heart attached upon. "So... how does it work ?"

"Once you start using it, you will be able to control its powers and reverse them. To increase your power, only one thing to do : Open your heart to others, and their smiles will be your reward."

"What, but that's completely ridi-", Nami said, but saw that the entire stand had disappeared. She was surprised, but she didn't especially care, it was free after all. She decided to put it immediately, and suddenly a flash occured. She felt a warm feeling inside, but nothing happened.

"She scammed me ! Wait, no she didn't, it was free. Oh well, the necklace is pretty"

With that, Nami got back on the ship, thinking about the words of this old lady...
1312.title: Generous = Giant ?

choices: She lands at a reasonable hundred-foot height
She lands big enough to stretch her legs across the city
Well...hope Alabasta likes being underneath Vivi's butt
133.content:
Nefertari Vivi, princess of Alabasta and heir to the throne, smiled as she gazed out of a tower window overlooking the fair capitol city of Alubarna, the desert landscape shifting so easily in the winds. The climate was fairly mild today for some reason, the heat not as exhausting or bearing down as it usually was. Even a gentle breeze flowed through her long blue hair, making her sigh in contentment at the cool wind.

She did have duties right now as a princess, but for now she had decided to escape to a far off tower in the castle, the highest peak, allowing a grand view of the country and all of its citizens and sand. She smiled, looking down. From here, they all almost looked like bugs scurrying about, and she chuckled, wondering what it'd be like to be this big and see the world as such. Vivi did allow herself such silly thoughts every now and again. She did travel with the strangest pirate crew and a rubber captain for a few months, so zany and insane things were pretty much a given.

In her daydream, she got up and intended to walk back to the main castle body, only to bump into a bookshelf quite roughly, sending a few items falling. "Oh!" The princess exclaimed, snapping out of her daze, wincing as books and heirlooms clattered to the floor. She sighed and knelt down, beginning to pick them all up and restore them to their proper places on the shelves, until her hand traced along a small medallion.

It was a blue-diamond scarab piece with a golden chain linking it altogether, giving it a fair, but simple elegance. Vivi held it in her palm, appreciating the necklace and the beauty of it. Her family had many treasures in store in a great vault, but this seemed to have been misplaced amongst dusty old books and scrolls. "What are you doing up here friend?" She chuckled, unclasping the necklace and putting it around her neck, the scarab falling snugly into her cleavage.

She got up and once again began walking to the exit of the tower, only taking a few steps before pausing. She could hear the sound of rock cracking and shifting ever so slightly. With her ears attuned to the sound, it seemed to be coming from right underneath her feet. After a minute or so of listening, the blue-haired beauty shrugged, thinking it was just the ancient tower groaning as it usually did with such an old age as it was.

Vivi began to walk once more, but stopped just before reaching the exit. Her eyes were now level with the top of the doorframe. "That...that can't be right." She said to herself, taking a step back, hearing the shifting of rocks once more. When she had come into the room, the top of the doorframe was easily above her head, and large enough to allow a tall figure such as her father or Inagram to pass through. Now, she would have to duck and crouch just to get through the passage.

Suddenly her eyes opened wide at the sight before her as the passageway's doorframe seem to lessen before her, now the top of it only chest height to her, her head almost touching the ceiling, blue strands of hair just brushing it. "What is going o-" Just as she took a step back, her foot went right through the floor, making her yelp a bit in panic. The desert princess looked down to see cracks running along the floor where she had stepped, her weight having caused enough damage to go right through solid stone with that last step.

"Maybe I should get on more solid ground..." She murmured to herself, trying to take gentle, tiptoeing baby steps, but only succeeded in making more cracks and bumping her head against the ceiling as she grew slowly.

"This is all so..." She sighed in exasperation, rubbing the spot where her head had hit the ceiling. "....Normal, I have to admit." Vivi shrugged. Adventures with the strawhat pirates had given her quite a taste for the strange. "Now, just need to figure out why I grew..." She muttered to herself, rubbing her chin thought. She would tap her foot, but didn't want to create anymore holes than need be in the floor.

Her fiddling hands eventually went to the scarab necklace, fingers gracefully rolling the piece around. Before her quizzical mind could go over it all, she winced a bit, her back now pressing up against the ceiling, forcing her to crouch just to keep from busting through the top of the tower. "Now this is just getting uncomfy...and impossible to get out of." Vivi sighed. She wouldn't even fit through the frame now without breaking anything.

As the seconds crawled by, more and more of her back pressed up against the ceiling, forcing her onto her hands and knees to get into a position low enough just to fit in the room. Her fine, elegant clothing was beginning to tear, and her feet were beginning to press up against the walls, making cracks form all over the room.

"Alright...alright. Maybe if I just stay still...nothing bad will happen."

The groaning sound of the tower straining against her weight and continuous size said otherwise.

"I...have to get out of here before this entire tower topples over." Vivi realized, mentally facepalming. She would physically facepalm, but that would send a shoot of cracks that would most definitely make the floor beneath her cave in.

Vivi took in a deep breath before kicking back with her right foot, easily smashing straight through the wall behind her. She repeated the process with her left leg, hopefully creating a hole big enough for her to fit through. Fortunately, the tower remained standing through the process of wall-demolishment. "Here I go..." Vivi said nervously to herself, beginning to crawl backwards, fitting her rear end through the hole. With a final push and a shove, she went flying out of the hole.

She had forgotten that there was nearly a three-hundred foot drop to the bottom.

Vivi screamed on the way down, unknown to the fact that she was beginning to grow once more.
133.title: The Desert Princess

choices: She decides to wander around a bit at this new size
Some guards come to check up on her
She looks back up in the tower for any clues
1331.content:
Vivi had her eyes closed on the way down, expecting a rough, and very painful landing. All she felt was a light thud as she made contact with the sands below, the familiar terrain shifting ever so slightly underneath her weight. She opened her eyes slowly, glad to see that she seemed completely fine. No broken bones, no bruises, though her rear end did feel a little sore after the fall.

"Well, I think I'm alright!" She smiled, only to immediately cover her mouth. Her voice seemed much more...louder than she had initially anticipated, almost in a booming sense perhaps, like when her adventures returning back to Alabasta had her encounter the giants Dorry and Brogy.

She blinked slightly, taking in the sight around her. Sitting down, even her head was higher than most of the buildings around her, and the people scurrying below in fear at the sight of a giant princess appeared nothing more than toys.

"Oh..." She sighed once more, standing up slowly, feeling debris and fall fall off of her elgs and posterior. "Sorry!" She looked down, seeing an imprint of herself in the ground, a crushed stall and some carts underneath. Luckily the attendants to the cart were out of the now, looking at their destroyed property, then back up to the looming giantess above, looking down at them nervously.

"Once again, sorry! On behalf of the Nefertari family, I'll be sure to recompense you all with a new stall, cart, and supplies." She tried to calm them down. Sighing, she looked back up at the tower, something she could easily ascend now if she wished, and up at the hole she had created at a much smaller size. "Well...wonder how I'll get out of this." Vivi muttered to herself. No pirates or adventurers to help her now, she only had her own actions and thoughts on this one.
1331.title: She lands at a reasonable hundred-foot height

choices: She decides to go explore the desert
She sits down and waits to shrink hopefully
She decides to play with the guards to ease her boredom
1332.content:
With a mighty crash and a yelp from Vivi, she landed forcefully, sending a quake through the area. "Well, I knew I was getting heavy, but not like that..." She muttered to herself, rubbing her backside from the landing. She could hear panicked shouts and screams from below, making her wince. "Now now, don't be afraid..." She tried to act as a proper princess should and condone her subjects. Vivi looked down, gasping slightly.

Scurrying around and even under her legs were tiny little bugs, well, people that could be mistaken for bugs, and now she knew the reason for their fright. A massive woman just doesn't appear out of the blue for no reason and not send an upset throughout the area. Currently, Vivi was resting against the castle, the tallest tower now roughly halfway up her back.

"Umm..." Right now ,she was slightly amazed at just how quickly she had grown, now at a vantage point where it was even better than the tower's sight, giving her a full view of the whole kingdom from this high up. If she wanted to, she could even stretch out her legs and have her feet rested over the city gates.

But no, she just wanted to move out of harms way before she did any more damage. No doubt the castle's structure took quite some damage from the impact of her fall, as did the surrounding buildings and villa. After a deep breath, Vivi began to stand, hoping to place her feet in the most open of spaces so she didn't knock anything else over. As she stood, the people below could only watch and stare as her size nearly doubled at her full height, making her all the more towering, chunks of buildings and sand falling from her.

"Alright Princess Vivi, you can do this. Remember, poise, elegance, gentleness." She muttered to herself, remembering walking tips as a princess should. She raised her foot, more and more sand falling from her soft sole down onto the city below, and she brought it down onto an empty street, making the whole area shake. She repeated the process step by step, aiming for more open areas. She did accidentally knock over an upper portion of a taller building with her swinging foot, making her cringe a bit.

In a few more earth-shaking steps, she was over the city walls, giving the guards positioned there a good view up her looming form as she strided over them into the empty desert area outside of the main city.

"Ah, much better. Nobody to step on or break out here." Vivi said quite proudly to herself, hands on hips as she dug her bare feet and toes into the warm Alabasta sands.
1332.title: City-Stretcher

choices: As he fell, the guard accidentally jostled Vivi's scarab necklace a bit.
Guard's arrive with a status report
13323.content:
Vivi sighed in content as she dug her toes in and out of the desert sands. What would be scorching hot to a normal-sized person was refreshingly warm to her giant soles. In fact, the climate overall was preferable. It was still warm to be sure but compared to a desert's heat Vivi felt more of a summer beach sort of heat. "Hmm...the ocean isn't too far away...Especially like this. Maybe I could..."

"Your Highness!"

The giantess looked to where the voice came from. Near her feet were a trio of men but aside from that they weren't particularly recognizable. "Who are you?"

"We're members of the guard your Highness. Are you okay?"

"So long as everyone in Alabasta is fine then I'm okay." She smiled strongly.

Seeing Vivi still very much alive and well made the guards notably at ease. "Thank goodness. What happened?"

"I'm not entirely sure. I was in the tower by the castle and then...I fell and...Oh! I just realized. Maybe this has something to do with it." She gestured to the scarab necklace around her neck. "After I put this on I started to grow."

The guard's nodded, "We'll send someone into town to look into this." The man turned his head and quickly gave an order Vivi didn't catch. Without hesitation one of the two soldiers turned and hurried into town.

"You can all be dismissed." Vivi laughed nervously, "I doubt anyone's going to hurt me like I am now."

"That may be so your Highness but it's our job as guards to protect you with our lives!" Stubbornly the two remaining guard's positioned themselves on either end of Vivi's enormous feet. She stifled a chuckle looking at the two muscular men guarding her toes with their lives. Their dedication was a bit overprotective, but admirable.

Wow...They're barely the size of my toes. Vivi realized. If she lingered in Alabasta any longer who knew how many would've been crushed by her steps? She made the right choice. Her father would be proud. She nodded approvingly, reflecting on the last few minutes. Any minute now a guard would come hurrying with a means of returning her to normal. She just needed to be patient...If only her pride and enthusiasm lasted.

Twenty minutes. Twenty minutes passed in glum silence as Vivi and her protectors awaited someone to come update them on the situation. She tried several times to initiate a conversation or two but once the guards went back to work they entered their habitual silence. After yet another failed attempt Vivi sighed, "I understand you guys are just doing your jobs but really, you don't need to watch over me! I'm not a little girl anymore! Literally!" The guards were too tired of this argument to respond. They knew she was right but that wasn't the point. Vivi hugged her knees and looked at her feet with a bored look. Alabasta was on a strict lock-down to avoid the danger of her crushing anyone and her only two companions were about as sociable as rocks. She hated doing nothing, especially when it meant inconveniencing someone else. Her toes drummed in a desperate attempt to vent some mild frustration.

"Excuse me your Highness." A guard spoke up moments after she started this.

"Hmm?"

"I mean no disrespect but...could you please stop doing that?" He looked to Vivi's toes nervously. "It's a little unnerving."

She couldn't help it. Vivi laughed. "Seriously? I need protection but your scared of my toes?"

"Not scared! It's just hard to concentrate when they're all bouncing on the ground like that." The second guard snickered alongside Vivi.

"Come on! I bet a big, strong guard like you can handle my foot!" Vivi propped a foot upright. "You're almost a fifth as tall. You can do it." A mischievous idea came to mind. Vivi giggled as her devious side toyed with the idea before settling on a course of action. "...And for your sake I hope you do." Much to the guard's surprise Vivi's foot began to lower onto him. Caught off guard he wasn't able to do much more than reach up and try to hold off the giantess's foot with his bare hands. Vivi's foot stopped its descent and fought to lower itself to the floor. The guard gritted his teeth and pushed as hard as he could to fend off the gigantic foot. He was already sweating bullets meanwhile Vivi was barely even trying.

"Is that all you can do? I'm not even trying to lower my foot you know!" She laughed.

"Your Highness please!"

I really have been hanging around Nami too much. "If you insist!" Vivi increased her foot's pressure slightly, smirking as she felt the man beneath it buckle down to his knees and struggle. His strength vanished in moments and with a last little push Vivi had him trapped beneath her sole. "My hero." She said in the most princess-y voice she could. Muffled cries came from beneath Vivi's foot, begging to be freed. The giantess gleefully ignored them. "I thought I needed protecting? Are you trying to say you, a big guard, can't even get out from under my foot?" She re-positioned herself slightly so that the man was beneath her big toe. "Or maybe even just a toe? Is that too much for you?" Despite all his struggle's Vivi's foot was going nowhere. In fact it felt kind of nice...like a little massage.

Meanwhile as this all happened the second guard watched from the other end of Vivi's feet and was in hysterical laughter. "She's got you there mate!"

"How about you then tough guy?"

The guard turned blue when he saw Vivi eyeing him next. Smirking, she reached down for him. He seemed smarter than his friend. Instead of trying to out muscle Vivi he quickly turned to run. However he was nowhere near as fast as her. Effortlessly Vivi plucked him from the ground and balanced him in her palm.

"Your Highness p-please be reasonable!"

"Like you were?"

"..."

"Thought so." She giggled, gently blowing into her palm and knocking the man off his feet. "Look out! Here come's my finger!" Vivi's index finger bent inwards and poked into the tiny guard. He tried to hold it off but unlike before Vivi didn't hold back much. He was instantly trapped. "Come on, you didn't even put up a fight! At least your friend is still struggling under my foot!"

"Man what's the point?" The guard sighed, "Have your fun Princess. It's our job to as a you like."

"Is that so? Even if I were to say....be hungry?"

"Yes even if-Oh my God!" The guard cut himself short as Vivi opened her mouth and began to bring him closer in. He fought with all his might against her finger, still not budging in the slightest. Her tongue poked gently from between her lips and rested on her finger's knuckle. The guard saw it loomed high above him, slowly tracing her finger down to his tiny frame. Despite all his efforts he wasn't able to move away by the time Vivi's tongue licked his entire body. The guard felt his entire body get assaulted and soaked by the slimy appendage for a full minute before it went away. What he heard next was not reassuring.

"Tasty!"

That finally did it. With all his strength, plus being slicked up by Vivi's saliva, the guard managed to free himself and take off running. His only concern was avoiding the finger that already hunted for him again. He kept an eye over his shoulder to make sure it wasn't gaining on him, running full speed.

"Look out!"

As a result he wasn't watching where he was running.

The guard felt his foot hit air and immediately realized he ran right off Vivi's hand. He tried to turn around and catch himself but it was too late. He plummeted to what had to have been certain death. Only...it wasn't. His landing was surprisingly soft...Was it the soft embrace of heaven? Thunderous laughter from above him begged to differ.

"I was just playing with you! I wasn't going to eat you!" Vivi was in tears, and the guard realized why. He fell right into Vivi's cleavage. His fatal flaw was cushioned by the two building-sized breasts on either end of him. In a way he really did die and go to heaven.

Vivi calmed herself down to a giggle, "Since I scared you so much you can rest there for a minute okay?"

Yep, it really was heaven.
13323.title: Guard Duty

choices: She notices tiny specks in the water....marine ships?!
Vivi gets up and decides to explore
She waits it out and fiddles with the scarab necklace once again...
1333.content:
Everything was nothing but a shadow as all of Alabasta gazed up to the dark sky above. Some could make out a sky of skin, some nothing but soft fabric filling their vision. In the end, it was all the same as the sky literally crashed down onto them, sending a powerful reverberating quake throughout the whole planet, cracks forming for miles underseas and creating rocking waves to crash into other nearby landmasses.

So, Vivi pretty much sitting down on her whole country was catastrophic. Of course, she didn't know this yet. To her, she was still falling, eyes closed shut and whimper in her voice.

But slowly she opened them to a clear blue sky and an empty area of nothing but a puddle that appeared to be everywhere, occasional dots of rock and earth and moss here and there in varying shapes and sizes."What...what happened? Where am I?" She asked herself, her words normal to her, but thunderous, booming, and echoing over the whole world for all to hear.

"Alright Vivi....you can figure this out." She said to herself, crossing her arms over her chest. "The last thing that happened was that you grew, then you began to fall. I honestly expected to painfully hit sand or maybe fall into a fruit stand or something, but that didn't happen. You're...somewhere strange....and pretty empty." She looked around to emphasize the emptiness of the area to herself.

Under her full rump, she felt a little itch, and wiggled it a bit, demolishing whatever had survived the initial impact of the meteor of her rear crashing down onto a whole country-isle, sending a rumble through the whole area.

"Maybe...somebody with teleporting devil fruit powers kidnapped me?" She mused.

"Or...maybe I'm dreaming."

"Or....the crash killed me and this is the afterlife. Pretty boring if you ask me..." The blue-haired princess sighed to herself, beginning to dip her fingers into the nearby water, playing it it, unknowingly crushing smaller islands with either her fingers or the vast, towering waves created from just her splashing around.
1333.title: Alabasta No More

choices: Vivi checks up on the "Marshes" She just walked through
Hmm? The Straw Hats seem to have found themselves somewhere on Vivi
13332.content:
"Well I'm not going to get any answers just sitting around here." The princess said aloud, rising to her feet. At her full height she made out more of the area around her. "I must be in some kind of marsh or something." As far as her eyes could see there were only little chunks of land with large puddles of water between them. At a glance the deepest parts of the water seemed just about knee-level. Really that was about it. None of the bits of dry land Vivi could see were much bigger than her feet. Maybe at a couple were as big as her full body but those seemed rather scarce.

"Honestly, I hope I find someone somewhere close." Aside from herself Vivi saw no one else. Sighing the woman took her first step into the thin waters and set off in a random direction.

Vivi simply couldn't comprehend those marshes she was wading through was in fact the Grand Line. The tiny bits of land she spotted were some of the largest islands in the sea. Most however were unnoticable specks before the giantess. Not a single person in the ocean was unable to see her. All throughout the Grand Line news spread to the rest of the globe of the towering titaness and her unaware rampage across the seas. Warnings were spread, precautions made, forces sent out. With every step she took Vivi ended countless lives, not even aware she was doing it. The average island was hardly noticeable beneath her feet. One by one entire island nations were crushed under foot. Each step Vivi took either destroyed something or created a tidal wave ready to destroy something. Whether or not she realized it she was quickly destroying the world.

She had to be stopped. That was why the Marines stepped in. Not that Vivi could tell. From her perspective she was merely wading through a large puddle. She didn't notice the armies of specks in those seas gunning for her. As many officers as the Marines could muster were sent out en masse with all the weaponry and tricks they had available. They barraged Vivi with everything they had. Cannons, Devil Fruit Powers, Sea Kings, Giants, Androids, Swords, if it was able to be used as a weapon it was used on Vivi. The attack focused on a single ankle. If they could knock the giantess off her balance they could then go for her throat and end her rampage. They only had a few seconds between steps to make their last stand, it had to count. It all was unleashed in seconds. For a moment Vivi stopped walking. The smoke blocked all view of her ankles to the Marines on the waters. Did it work? Did they make her mad? Or did Vivi finally realize what was going on?

A moment later it was all too clear. With a single lazy motion Vivi's other foot moved and waved away the smoke with its immense force whereupon it then scratched the back of her ankle before she carried on.

Everything the Marine's had, concentrated into a surefire instant strike, made Vivi's ankle itch. Once her foot rose out of the ocean all in the attack saw a tidal wave engulf them whilst another island met its end beneath Vivi's sole.

"I wonder how big I am?" The blue-haired mega giantess wondered aloud. She recalled growing briefly before ending up where ever she was. She shut her eyes while growing so it was hard to say. "What if I'm something absurd like fifty feet tall?" She laughed, imagining it. "I'd have to be very careful with where I walk. I could accidentally crush something." Another nation found itself smushed beneath Vivi's toes.

"Could be fun though..." She continued to muse aloud, "Maybe I could help Luffy and the others on their journey. I bet the Marines couldn't handle a giantess...Well I suppose they have giants too don't they?" She sighed, "Even in my fantasies I'm not that strong." Ironically the next land she unknowingly crushed was a specialized military island.

"I could do a lot of good as a giant though. I can speed up construction and deliveries for my people immensely. Maybe I should look into that when I return." The giantess wiped some dirt off her butt, unknowingly sending the last remnants of her homeland to the depths.

"Hmm?" Vivi stopped in her tracks. Before her was the biggest landmass yet. It was a red wall about half Vivi's height that seemed to go on forever in either direction. "That kind of reminds me of..." Vivi's eyes widened, "...The Red line..." The continent that marked the halfway point of the Grand Line. An immense wall that rose up for miles from the bottom of sea level and went across the entire planet as a giant dividing wall. That was what was in front of her.

"Oh my..." Vivi realized just how big she actually was.
13332.title: Unaware Rampage

choices: She grows big enough to crush entire continents
Looks like Vivi can hold the earth like a ball now
13333.content:
After splashing her fingers around in the water a bit, Vivi grew bored and wiped some debris from her fingers, sending tons of earth that once was inhabited islands, now nothing but annoying dirt specks that had the misfortune of getting stuck to the pads of her fingers. "Well, guess I'm really the only person actually around." She sighed to herself, leaning back and planting her hands once again into the 'puddle', feeling the earth give way a bit beneath her weight, sending a shoot of cracks through tectonic plates in the area, generating more and more damaging earthquakes, but obviously not even felt by the overgrown princess.

"Must be...on a small island somewhere. Can't be that big, the landscape doesn't seem to stretch that much." She continued to speak to herself, humming a tuneless song to herself, sending echoes and booms heard all over the globe. Marine forces had already been dispatched to 'deal' with her, if you could even deal with a giant big enough to crush an entire country beneath her, World Government leaders were already discussing what to do with the enlarged princess, and pirates were already raring for an adventure on this newly formed landmass, joking about visiting her mountains and such.

Of course, Vivi knew nothing of any of this. To her, she was still her normal sized self and not the biggest living thing on the planet, giving even the greatest giants and monsters of legend a run for their money in sheer size and power she now possessed.

She had thought about getting up and exploring, our just sit tight and wait out. She might've slipped into one of those strange oasis's one occasionally finds in the desert, and she's still in Alabasta somewhere. Perhaps some guards will come and fetch her in no time flat. Maybe even the whole scene of her growing was just a fever dream, it was rather hot in that tower, and there was dangers of not keeping properly hydrated and cooled in such a hot climate.

With another annoyed sigh at all of this, Vivi decided to stay put. Besides, the ground neath her was actually pretty comfy, forming perfectly round her soft butt. While she sat and waited, her long and elegant fingers went back up to fiddling with the scarab necklace she had found while in the tower. The gem flashed briefly, but not enough for Vivi to take notice as she longingly gazed into the distance, mind wandering off.

Vivi didn't even notice as she began to grow, just by the slightest of inches to her, but hundreds of feet to those who were smaller, her size drastically changing by the second. Reports were sent out to nearby islands of the growing goddess, people actually having a chance to be prepared this time and possibly avoid being crushed by her.

Entire islands and cities were being evacuated, fleeing from the expanding form of Vivi on the horizon, who seemed to not even care or notice as her body grew more and more, taking up miles of the ocean as her long legs only loomed further over the area, her rear crashing into the earth and creating more cracks, and her upper body looming so high up she disappeared into a blur, making the cloud layer seem all too pitiful as it tried to keep up with her ever-increasing height.

Eventually her growth hit a kickstart as she only continued to play with the scarab piece, whatever causing her to grow touch-based as her fingers played with the jewel insect. From inches to her did her growth shoot up to feet, and Vivi did take notice now, making her wide eyes blink a bit as she took it all in. "Oh...guess it was real then. I'm growing...again!" She exclaimed, long leaving behind her tiny form of crushing Alabasta underneath. Now she grew onwards for miles and miles, crushing the smaller landmasses underneath and against her bulldozing form easily. Vivi didn't even take notice of them, thinking they were bits of dirt or rocks that simply laid about in the puddle.

It wasn't until her head was high up in the atmosphere did...things begin to settle in with her. The area around her seemed to lessen only more and more, the usual amount of land diminishing greatly. The sky before her no longer seemed blue, but greyish, then finally, black like the night sky littered with stars. Far below, she could make out the area like a map, literally.

The world was becoming like a map before her, and she gasped in realization just at how colossal she truly was now, and still growing all the same.

choices: Bottle it up! Let's see what happens!
Screw them! How dare they tell you what to do!
1341.content:
It was a bright and early sunrise that was cast over Amazon Lily that day. The seas around the island were unusually calm, and not just because said island was situated in the line of ocean known as The Calm Belt. The inhabitants heard nary a peek, whisper or Neptunian decimating a whale's carcass when they awoke in their beds, placing all of the people on the island into a mindset akin to snuggling into a warm bed on a cool, winter's night.
All, except one particularly loud denizen of the Royal Palace.
"Luffy!" came the shrilled voice echoing throughout the massive structure. The loud screech blasted Sandersonia and Marigold out of their respective beds and into a panic.
"That sounded like Hancock!" hissed Sandersonia, picking herself off of the ground in a huff. Marigold stayed face down on the palace floor.
"Well, whatever it is, I'm sure our sister can handle it."
Sandersonia placed her hands on her hips. "You're just saying that so you can go back to sleep."
Marigold stared as fiercely as she could at her sister from her low perch. "What? No. I have complete trust in Hancock's ability to sort out her own issues."
Another yell and another burst of Conqueror's Haki flew into their room, cracking several windows and shattering a nearby mirror. Both sisters exchanged a worried glance before racing towards the source of the noise.

Sandersonia and Marigold approached Hancock's bedroom quietly, taking note of what appeared to sound like scuffling from behind the door. Each sister placed their backs on either side of the door and mouthed each other orders.
"Ready?" 'said' Marigold. "Let's catch 'em by surprise." The orange-haired woman reared her arm back, and with a burst of Armament Haki, sent the double doors flying off their hinges.
"We've got you...now...?"
Inside the bedroom lay Hancock, hands underneath her sheets, squirming like a fish caught on a hook. Contrary to what her screams indicated, her face was contorted in a state of bliss - her eyes were closed tight.
"Er," murmured Sandersonia to her equally dumbfounded sister, "I think she's...dreaming." A low moan escaped from Hancock's lips, accompanied by a serious of sounds that somewhat resembled the name of a familiar straw hatted pirate. "About Luffy, it seems."
Marigold crossed her arms over chest. "S-should we wake her up?"
"Yes, but slowly. I think sis would have a fit if we woke her up from this."

After several minutes of coercion, the sisters managed to pull the euphoric Pirate Empress form her perfect world. Despite their efforts, Hancock was still quite annoyed with her siblings.
"You needn't wake me, I was perfectly fine." One gesture from her sisters opened Hancock's eyes to the squalor that was now her bedroom. Half of her sheets were strewn across the room, glass was peppered along the tiles, curtain rails hung on for dear life, leaving their curtain partners in a mess on the ground. Her eyes widened. "Perhaps I got a bit excited..."
"A bit?" snorted Marigold. "Sis, your Haki was growing out of control. Maybe your love for Luffy is..." She stopped dead once she received a frosty glare from the raven-haired Empress. "...never mind."
Sandersonia leaned against a bed post. "Mari does have a point though. I can easily see this winding up in some sort of disaster. What if we weren't here? You could have brought the whole island down based on what we heard."
Hancock gripped her bed sheets tightly. "B-but I love him... So much..."
"We know sis, but at least try to keep a handle on it for-"
"Shut up!" Several pillows were flung across the room in Sandersonia and Marigold's direction. "Don't tell me how to live my life! Get out!"
"But sis-"
"Out!"
Both sisters looked at each other glumly before giving their infuriated sister one last glance as they exited the messy bedroom. Hancock flew onto her back, huffing loudly. She snatched the only pillow that wasn't ejected off her bed and smushed it into her face - her angry, muffled screams could be heard outside her bedroom door, much to the chagrin of her concerned siblings.

After several hours of angered mumbling and pacing Hancock finally gained the resolve to think about what her sisters had tried to say.
Perhaps they're right. Maybe I should try to keep my love for Luffy in, she thought to herself. But how will I show Luffy I would turn the world upside down for him if he doesn't see it? Hancock looked down at her body, noting that she would had to have someone fix several buttons that had burst off of her pajama top. I mean, he barely notices me as it is.
Boa Hancock could be described as nothing short of breathtakingly beautiful. She stood at a statuesque height of 6'3, with perfectly aligned facial features, sparkling eyes and curves that would make an hourglass hang it's head in shame. Her enormous breasts jutted out from her chest, each one roughly the size of her head, in complete contrast to her slender figure. Any man in the world would kill to just stand in front of her, as she had proven innumerable times throughout her life.
All except one, however. And as if fate itself were laughing at her, he was the only man that she loved in her entire life. Still loves, as a matter of fact.
"Oh!" She through a dramatic hand to her forehead. "I just don't know what to do. Maybe I could give this 'bottling up' thing a try?"
1341.title: Amazon Lily

13411.content:
All in all, Hancock had done reasonably well in keeping her feelings for Luffy from destroying more things within the palace. She had worked out, in her opinion, a fairly logical way to keep her mind off of him.
Get pissed at everyone else.
Never did Hancock think that she would ever succumb to waiting outside of a public bathhouse, just to flash people her chest as they walked past. As her mammoth mammies bounced out in front of the poor (or lucky) passerby, Hancock would utilise her Love-Love powers and petrify them on the spot, claiming that they had dared seek the eye of the Gorgon on her back. It was only after her hundredth or so victim did the citizens of Amazon Lily start to grow suspicious of their Snake Empress. Hancock, after solidifying anyone who questioned her motives, relocated back to The Royal Palace just as the dinner feast had begun. She told her staff about what she had done that day, resulting in many gasps and just as many silences. However, the problem was easily fixed once the raven-haired woman lay on them her puppy-dog eyes for the umpteenth-trillionth time. It was only when her sisters dragged Hancock aside did she undo her handy work, complaining the entire time.
And not once had she thought about Luffy, not once the entire day, not once the entire night so far. That is, until she was caught alone in her bedroom with her own thoughts.

Hancock had been busy hanging one of her numerous pet kittens upside down by it's hindlegs, when she spotted her self-titled diary: 'The Super Secret Lovey Dovey Empress Album of Luffy's Shenanigans and Hijinks' on her desk (right next to her other self-titled book called: 'Nami and Robin: A Chronicle of Two Sluts.') Instantly, Hancock's hands went to her heart, clutching it as her thoughts began to form the image of-
She slapped her self mentally and physically. "I won't think about him. I won't think about him," she chanted to herself. She threw herself onto her bed, kicking away a kitten (who had just got its bearings after it had been dropped on its head) on her way there, and tried to force her mind onto something else.
After squirming and struggling for hours on end, Hancock finally fell asleep due to exhaustion, successfully not thinking about Luffy the entire day. In her sleep, however, her subconscious betrayed her brain, sending countless, virtual situations of Luffy and her marrying each other. As she begin to giggle and drool in her sleep, something else was happening to Hancock's body.

Like soft dough rising in a pan, Hancock's body began to slowly inch upward and outward.
