15133.title: Everyone but Robin?

choices: ".....You don't know who I am? I'm......Goddess of the Sea."
151331.content:
AUTHOR'S NOTE: This chapter was NOT written by me. It was written by Spiral-And-Twist.

http://www.writing.com/main/portfolio/vi...

He's having computer issues but asked me to post this nonetheless.
-------

The sky was a calm blue, but it's peaceful visage did not match the seas that laid below. The Thousand Sunny, a grand ship inhabitated by the infamous Straw Hat Pirates, was in utter turmoil as it was tossed about by the broiling waves of the ocean. The captain of the vessel was merrily laughing through the storm, calmly resting on the bow of the deck. The rest of the crew scattered about the ship, all having their own personal reaction to the destructive waters around them. One swordsman simply sat crosslegged in the saturation that bore down on them, remaining as calm as his captain Luffy. A navigator tried to set out a map and keep it dry, trying to figure out what their coordinates were at the moment. She had never seen waters like this on any of her maps before. A cook pretended to be attending to his ingredients, bringing them all down safely to the kitchen, but in reality he was simply swooning at glances of the lovely navigator Nami. Two others, their marksman and doctor, were either crying or screaming as they held onto one another, shouting that their deaths were going to be soon. Another, their shipwright of sorts, was repairing damages to the Thousand Sunny as quickly as it was attacked by the ocean. Just one crewmate was missing however...where was their acheaologist?

"Luffy!"Nami cupped her hands around her mouth to call out to the cheery, naive man."Have you seen Robin anywhere? Nobody can find her below or above deck!"

He turned and shrugged."Nope."

"....Nope?"

"Yep."

"You mean you've seen her?"

"Nope."

"You just said 'yep' though."

"That was for the nope."

"......"

With her face as stern and annoyed as it could be, Nami walked across the deck and pulled him off the bow, Luffy retorting like a scolded child, his arms stretching an amazing length as he tried to hold onto the bow, Nami dragging the rest of him away. With a sigh she released him, only to send him like a slingshot right back to the front of the ship, almost cleanly knocking him off into the dangerous seas surrounding them. As Luffy looked over the side, he took in a big whiff of air, expecting the usual salty smell, but instead, another curious scent."Nami...."

"...What is it now...?"

"Why does the ocean smell like clean soap?"

"How am I supposed to know?!"

He shrugged, continuing to watch the strange new sea, giggling as bubbles the size of mountains and larger began to pop out of the ocean. The rest were as flabbergasted as they watched this sight.

-------

Robin half giggled, half sighed as she submerged herself neck deep into a bathtub filled with sudsy soap and calming, warm water. As she slowly opened her eyes, she calmly looked down at the pitifully minute speck floating in the water around the area where her naval rested below. At first glance, others might simply mistake it for dirt or something else so meaninglessly tiny, but not Robin. She knew it was her shrunken crewmates. She giggled as she raised a hand and slowly churned the water near the ship-speck, wondering what confusion and chaos it was causing below to them. How it came to this, she knew not. It was some odd weather phenomenon the night before, and she was lucky enough to witness it. The ship had docked at a small island for the night, the local antives not minding pirates like themselves. Robin had stepped off the ship to gather a few supplies with some berries lended by Nami. As she returned to the ship, she stopped to gaze at the night sky, an odd occurance happening overhead. First, dark clouds gathered over the island, as if a storm was approaching. Then, the rain, nothing too odd. As she neared closer and closer to the docks, the hairs on the back of her neck shot straight up, warning her not to enter the ship. An instance later, a bolt of violent green lightning shot out of a cloud overhead, striking the Thousand Sunny. This strange weather continued on for several more minutes, and Robin simply watched in quiet fascination. Just as quickly as it came, it dissapeared. The storm had dissipated, leaving the night calm and serene once again, only inkiness outlined by a shining moon and twinkling dots of stars.

Sensing that the danger was over, Robin continued walking back towards the ship, but once again stopped. Did the ship seem smaller? As if a magic trick was being played before her eyes, the entire ship and everything on it seemed to reduce drastically by the second. In a matter of minutes, it was only as large as a child's toy, and still diminishing. How no one could notice this, Robin did not know. Her crewmates were known for being heavy sleepers. As she knelt down and scooped the shrinking vessel out of the water, she gazed at it curiously. She would have to continue her investigation later, as the ship needed a safer place to lay than just in her hand. With the remaining berries, she rented a room at a local inn for the night, and here she was now, watching the nigh microscopic ship float in bathtub water as she cleaned herself.

"How odd.....I hope everyone is okay...."Robin mused to herself, rising slowly out of the tub.

-----

"What.Is.THAT."Usopp screeched as he, along with everyone else, watched as the godlike leviathan rose out of the water. Larger than anything they had ever seen, it was like a living continent before them, casting a shadow for countless miles across them as it continued to stand."Whatever it is...it's...beautiful!"Sanji proclaimed with hearts in his eyes, recognizing the feminine form even when it was a million times larger."We should try to talk to her! Maybe she could tell us where we are."Luffy offered up the option.

"No way! She'd probably crush us for entering her waters! Something that big must have a temper!"Ussop countered, knees shaking.

"Well, we can't just stay here. Gotta do something."Zoro muttered, still half asleep.

------

To her surprise, as Robin gazed back down, the speck was heading towards her. Maybe her friends finally recognized their situation? She giggled and sat back down in the water, only to her chest though, the water pulling in and out of the sudded up, sopping wet orbs."Hello all."Robin greeted them as they neared her right nipple.

------

As the ship slowed to a stop, all they could do was be.....amazed at the sheer size of this being. Before them, a monument of fleshy pink rose out of the water, easily large enough to be a mountain, and that didn't even count the miles of soft flesh it was attatched to. Sanji tried everything he could to keep himself from nosebleeding out all of his vitals. When the goddess spoke, it was like a hundred thunderstorms and quakes rolled into one."Hello!!"Luffy shouted at the top of his lungs."What's your name, Miss Giantess?"

"Oh, you don't know who I am?"

"A-are we supposed t-t-to? You d-dont have a reputation f-for being mean, r-right?"Ussop asked nervously.

The giantess chuckled. Her next response was....
151331.title: The Shrinking of the Straw Hats

1513312.content:
"Really?!"Luffy exclaimed in reply, jumping up and down in excitement, his usual antics whenever facing something new or interesting such as this, a cosmic deity was before them. The Strawhats had faced so called 'Gods' before, whether in sheer power alone or a farce, but this seemed to be the real deal. The giantess was large enough to end any war or begin a catastrophe of apocalyptic proportions herself, and seemed to be invulnerable to any conventional means of attack. They were truly speaking with a goddess that had helped shape their world, or so it seemed.

"Of course,"Robin continued, but with a slight giggle. Why not have a little fun in the meantime while her friends were at this size? She wasn't harming anyone, and she could find a way to revert them to normal eventually."Everything you see blue before you,"She waved her hand out at the small body of water in the tub, the entire sky above the miniscule pirate ship filled with flesh tone from her palm."I created to separate civilizations and for all sealife to dwell within."She giggled once more, it felt almost ridiculous to sport such an amazing act of god, but she had to keep up the image since she said those words."I can control the very currents that guide your ship..."She dipped a finger into the soapy water besides the speck, twirling it lightly, but creating a vast whirlpool that threatened to suck the unknowingly shrunken Strawhats into the depths below."I can drown out an entire country if I so wish to do so...."She raised her hand again and made a small splash at a bar of soap floating nearby, the soap sinking underwater, the splash a tsunami and the soap a far-off continent to the pirates. They were in awe at what had just happened, so mundane an action was divine to them, they had just 'witnessed' a god wiping out an entire country."I..."Robin began to stand up, raising herself to her full height, the water only coming up halfway to her thighs, revealing her naked glory, her body a titanic immovable monument that reached higher than the sky could contend with, the Strawhats so far below couldn't even see past her waist, the rest of her upper body a far off blur."...Am the Goddess of the Sea!"She proclaimed, enunciating on the last word with a loud clap of her hands, a sonic boom that nearly shattered the eardrums of the tinies below.

".....Wow."Was what the entire crew stated simultaneously.

Robin knelt down and gently picked the ship up with the nail of her index finger, bringing it up to her eye for a better look at the speck."Now,"She thundered, making her voice as deep and godlike as it could be, which only doubled the depth and loudness of it for the Strawhats."What are you microbes doing in my territory?"

"We got lost, I think..."Luffy said.

"We had docked at this small island last night, and the next thing we know, we wake up floating in an ocean with a goddess taking a bubble bath in it."Nami added on, stepping forward from the group to speak with the deity."Do you know how we got here...err...your goddess-ness?"

"Of course I do, I....brought you all here."

"Why?!"

"Your...exploits and adventures have caught my eye, and I wished to meet the little pirates that have been causing so much chaos in my ocean."Robin replied, barely able to stifle the laughter building up beneath her words."Defying the world government, racking up quite a collective bounty on all of your heads, and even saving entire countries! Your deeds even reached the ears of the gods above you."

"Really?"Nami piqued, tilting her hand in curiosity."Does that mean we get a reward?"A cat-like grin began to spread across her face, her eyes turning into beri signs.

"In fact, it does."Robin began to search for a reward he could give to such microscopic beings."You all....."She paused to consider in her mind what to say to her friends.
1513312.title: Playing God

15133121.content:
Robin smirked as she continued her little game, “You all get the privilege to worship me.” She suppressed a snicker as the other Straw Hats all unanimously cried out “What?!”- Save for Sanji, who was more than eager to do anything for the monumental beauty.

“That sounds boring!” Luffy cried.

“That sounds humiliating.” Zoro grumbled.

“I’d love to oh Great Goddess!” Sanji exclaimed, earning a strong hit on the head from Nami’s clima-tact. The redhead stood forward “Uh…Goddess? What happens if we refuse this gift?” The giantess was silent as she placed the Thousand Sunny back on the sudsy waters, though she stood to her full height, casting a shadow over all of the water and her herself becoming a figure in the light. It might have been their imagination, but something about this Goddess looked familiar, and was she smiling?

Suddenly something rose from the water. It was big, dripping with water drops that could destroy the Sunny should they land on it. It was Robin’s foot, and she hovered it over the speck-sized ship. “Should you cross the Sea Goddess I will have no choice but to punish you.” Mentally Robin giggled at her makeshift game, it was surprisingly enjoyable to be so large and in charge.

The threat of being crushed was enough to make Nami back down with an apology, but Zoro and Luffy took a step forward, with a look in their eyes that said Challenge Accepted. The rest of the crew knew better though and proceeded to hit them on the heads for their stubbornness, especially Nami who practically beat them unconscious. “I am not going to die because you two are idiots!” Up above Robin chuckled, “You’d best listen to her mortals. That woman understands your situation.”

“But I’m going to be Pirate King!” Luffy roared back, springing back to life like the rubber he was.

‘And I’m the Sea Goddess. As such I outrank you future Pirate King.”

“Oh yeah…That makes sense.” Luffy mumbled as he sat back down. The rest of his crew looked to him with the universal shout, “Huh?!” Luffy just grinned as if that answered any arguments to his logic.

Brooke stepped forward, tipping his hat to the giantess. “It’s a pleasure Goddess, yohohoho! If I might be so bold…”

Nami turned her head to the skeleton, “Don’t do it….”

“Might I see your panties?”

BAM!

The moment Brooke asked his signature question Nami wheeled around and hit the skeleton hard enough to kill him (If he wasn’t already dead).

“Thank you.” Robin smiled as she began to lower herself back down.

“Anything to please you Sea Goddess.” Nami laughed nervously, the rest of the crew were silent; but they had the feeling if they said anything Nami would be quick to hit them again.

“Thank you Nami, you are such a wonder little servant. But as I said, what I desire is worship.” Nami cringed at the word servant but she bit her tongue as Sanji rose back into the scene. “Anything you want my dear Goddess. I’ll kiss the very ground you walk on should you ask!”

The Sea Goddess smiled, “That’s good, especially for what I have in mind for you.” A familiar structure rose from the ocean, causing a wave that nearly capsized the Sunny. Robin’s foot was now partially out of the water, about halfway. “Since you’re so eager I’ll allow you the pleasure of kissing my feet.”

Everyone turned to see Sanji’s rebuttal, but he was gone. Shouts came from the water and they turned to see the cook jumping along the air to the exposed soles of the giantess. He landed right in the gap between two wrinkles of her foot and ran straight up it like a wall. Given his intense leg strength in no time Sanji reached the crevice between Robin’s big and second toes where he immediately got on all fours and began to kiss the massive foot. Surprisingly he did so with the suaveness he was known for.

“Huh, I guess when a woman is so big and beautiful it really doesn’t matter to Sanji what they want.” Chopper noted.

Brooke stared at the scene with respect, “One must treat a woman very kindly yohohoho! Even with the most unusual of requests.”

“Yeah but…this is kind of embarrassing.” Name face palmed as Sanji let out exclamations of joy from his location.

“And as for you two.” Robin continued, pointing a massive finger at Luffy and Zoro. “For being so disobedient I ask that you massage my feet. All of them. The two strongest Straw Hats stared at the looming foot that rose countless miles into the air. A second one rose up to match it, both being so large it was insane. They looked as if they were about to protest but a look from Nami silenced them. Even so, they didn’t move.

“Tell you what, I am a kind Goddess. I respect your tenacity so, if you do this task for me I will personally prepare for you a feast grand enough even one of my size couldn’t finish it all.”

The moment food got involved Luffy had already slingshotted himself across the Sunny towards the massive looming sole. “I want lots of meat!” He cried as he collided against Robin’s foot and began to appease the massive appendages with a barrage of soft punches. Normally it would be the worst method of massaging possible, but given the size difference it was actually rather enjoyable, and Luffy’s Gomu Gomu no Mi powers were rather useful for it.

Zoro however, stood firm. “No.”

Usopp stepped near him, “Think of it as training. Look at Luffy, I bet he’s going to have the workout of his life. It’s the ultimate test of endurance and strength.” The liar gestured to the unmassaged foot as if it was beckoning Zoro. His expression shifted slightly but nothing else. Usopp looked to his crew mates for help, where Franky shouted out to Luffy. “Nice going Luffy! At this rate you’ll finish way before Zoro ever does. He doesn’t have a chance! You’re doing SUPER!”

That did the trick, “Doesn’t have a chance? Like hell!” In a burst of speed Zoro sprinted off the Thousand Sunny and swam his way to Robin’s remaining foot, where he began to pound it with his fists much like Luffy was doing. “I am not going to lose to him!” He roared.

The rest of the crew stared with wonder at Luffy and Zoro, unsure of what to think of it. “Good, now for you Franky…”Robin extended a massive finger towards the Sunny, “Climb on, you too Brooke.”

“How does she know our names?” Brooke asked aloud as he and Franky climbed into the ridges of the gigantic appendage. “Because I’m the Sea Goddess.” Robin answered plainly. “You two shall entertain me, Brooke I understand you are a talented musician. As such I’ll place you in my ear where you can play me songs.” Robin brought her finger towards her right ear, where the skeleton hopped off. Brooke pulled a violin from seemingly out of nowhere and began to casually strum along it, “I know just the song for a lovely Goddess such as yourself yohohoho…But it is kind of messy in here.” Brooke looked to the thick earwax before him. The giantess smiled as she heard soft music in her ear, “Franky, I’ve heard you are quite the talented dancer. So if you please, would you be willing to dance for me? There is an entire stage for you.” With a nod of her head Robin gestured to her open palm. Franky looked back to it and grinned, “Is that all? Lets do this!” The blue-haired cyborg ran his way to the endless expanse of hand where he instantly started his dancing. In seconds it stopped feeling like a chore and Franky felt as if he was at a party.

All that remained on the Sunny were Nami, Chopper, and Usopp, all of whom were scared for their tasks. With her free hand Robin scooped the ship from beneath the water and placed it in her cleavage, where a small pool of water was trapped by her breasts. Even so, the water was enough to be a large lake to the Straw Hats. “Nami,” Robin began as she brought her free hand’s index finger towards the ship, “As you were the quickest to accept me as your Goddess I shall reward you.” Nami imagined immense hordes of money and treasure so she hopped on without hesitation. Her disappointment was obvious when instead, Robin placed Nami on her right breast. “You may massage when you are ready.” The redhead grumbled, but she understood that they had no choice and fell to her knees and began to rub the squishy flesh she rested on. “I used to have the biggest boobs around you know…” She cried to herself.

Robin turned her attention to the remaining two Straw Hats. “Usopp, Chopper…” The two cowardly pirates embraced each other as they awaited their sentence. “…You shall have the easiest tasks. All I ask is that you sit there, and worship me as a Goddess.” The fear the two had quickly dissipated and was replaced by a fervent bowing motion in the direction of the looming Goddess. Under his breath Usopp muttered random words of praise about the “Merciful Goddess.”

With each Straw Hat now worshipping her in their own way Robin smiled as she let out a content chuckle. “This pleases me.”
15133121.title: Worshipping the Sea Goddess

choices: She ends the charade and reveals it's her
Robin decides to keep things going for just a little bit longer
151331211.content:
It was all still a game, but the giantess was happy she did it. Always she was serious, almost showing no emotion. This was a rare time when she just let herself go and enjoy things with something harmless and meaningless. It was making light of a dark situation. Plus if it happened to make her feel great that was just a bonus. Down at her feet she felt years of stress accumulated being slowly melted away, and Sanji’s devoted affection towards her toes had her look at her feet with a slight admiration, noticing how beautiful they actually were. In her ears Robin heard the loveliest of melodies from Brooke, who got so into it he sang. On her palm Franky was dancing with his best moves; moves so scandalous Robin struggled to suppress laughter at how ridiculous they were. A small pleasurable feeling from her breast thanks to Nami had Robin feeling good too. And to top it off her two friends Chopper and Usopp were bowing to her as if she was truly a Goddess. Eight little speck-sized people, all worshipping her. Robin wasn’t one to let things go to her head, but there was no denying the treatment she was getting was giving her a rush.

Perhaps most surprising of it though was the fact that many of the Straw Hats were actually enjoying themselves. Sanji was able to express his unrequited love for the Goddess-sized Robin, albeit in an unusual manner. Luffy and Zoro quickly forgot they were doing a chore and it evolved into a friendly competition they were enjoying. Brooke and Franky were doing what they loved. Even Chopper and Usopp smiled a bit as they realized that their Sea Goddess wasn’t going to do any harm. The only one who was hating life was Nami, who felt inadequate as a female compared to the flawless giantess she was pleasing.

Never in the two years she spent training did Robin ever imagine that their adventures in the New World would have something like this in them. Anything could happen in the New World, but even this was just impossible. As nice as it was though, it couldn’t last forever. Robin had to find a way to reverse the shrinking process. Perhaps tomorrow she could ask around the island. If it was a weather phenomenon there may be someone who knows something.

But that would be later, for now Robin allowed herself to just once, relax. The warm bath water continued to relieve her muscles and her friends were all pleasuring her. Though Robin found it somewhat humorous that they didn’t recognize her. Sure they were small, but were they that small? It was actually somewhat interesting to think about. What does the world look like from their eyes? Could they not recognize Robin because they couldn’t see that far? Did it blur out? Giggling Robin realized she was asking questions that only giants ask. Compared to her friends she was the biggest giant of them all.

However all good things must come to an end. An hour passed and the water turned cold long ago. Robin felt her skin begin to shrivel and each Straw Hat was nearing their limit in stamina. Except for Luffy, Sanji and Zoro, but they were animals anyway. With a sigh Robin told them to stop. “You may now stop, you’ve worshipped me long enough. For such a good job I have one more reward for you…” Carefully Robin collected each Straw Hat and balanced them on the tip of her finger. Carefully she brought the crew to her lips, where she planted her dearest friends with one loving, eternally grateful, kiss. To them the never-ending stretch of pink enveloped them in a soft cushion of appreciation for their efforts; it was almost like a massage of their own. When Robin pulled her finger back she placed them all back on the Thousand Sunny, still safely nestled in her cleavage.

“This has been most enjoyable Straw Hats, but it’s time.”

“Time?” Nami asked.

Luffy grinned and erupted into cheers, “Time for that feast!”

Robin smiled as she carefully removed the Sunny from her cleavage and equally carefully left the bathtub. To the Straw Hats it was as if she stepped from the water to some outer realm countless miles away, beyond the white borders of what they assumed was the Goddess’ realm, but was in fact her bathtub. Once outside Robin grabbed a towel and casually began to dry herself, unafraid of what her friends may see. “Yes, I should prepare that feast. And perhaps later on you all could worship me again.” As she became more and more dry Robin slid on some clothes. At first a black bra and panties, then over top of it a pink skirt that covered most of her legs and a blue blouse that barely covered her breasts at all. With one final motion she flipped her hair back over her head and looked as she usually did.

Now that saw clothed and her hair styled like it usually was, the Straw Hats saw the familiarity in the Goddess now. “Hey she looks really familiar…” Zoro mumbled. Given the size-scale though the massive giantess was still too large to fully grasp details. The giantess turned towards the bathtub and casually scooped her friends from it, her other hand pulling the plug for the water. For a brief moment Robin considered what to do. She could confess to her friends the truth and end the game, maybe having some fun with her friends as Robin and not as Goddess of the Sea. On the other hand she enjoyed playing the part, and doing it for a little while longer wouldn’t be too bad…
151331211.title: Worshipping Robin

choices: Robin returns and squashes the bug
Somebody else enters the room, and knows exactly where the Strawhats are...
1513312112.content:
"Now, I must keep you all hidden for some time..."Robin whispered to the group of specks in her hand, deciding her ruse as the Goddess of the Sea could continue for a tad longer."I can't let the other....Gods notice you."

"And why's that?"Luffy asked in his naive manner.

"Because....mortals are not allowed in our realm, at least not until they die."

"Oh....that makes sense."

"So..."She knelt down, her eyes scanning the surrounding area as to where she could hide her friends safely from the other 'Gods', or in reality, the hotel service as they bring in a meal for her and her miniaturized friends. The thought crossed her mind to simply ease them back into her bountiful cleavage, but that would risk a chance of them seeing the others as normal human beings and hearing her ordering food. She was fine with play-acting with them, but putting up a role as a Goddess to another human being would risk looking quite ridiculous. Finally, her gaze fell upon a pair of sandals she had worn in, casually tossed aside.Perfect...She thought to herself, pulling them over with her free hand. and lowering the hand with her tiny occupants towards the footwear, extending a finger out till it touched the sole where they could step off."This is...another realm that I own. You can stay here until I have retrieved the food for you."

One by one they stepped onto the sandal, each with a mixture of disgust and weariness."Eww...smells like feet in here."Nami exclaimed, crossing her arms over her chest and staring up at the titanic goddess that blurred beyond the heavens in her stature."I'm terribly sorry about that...demons haunt this place, so it's not the friendliest of abodes..."She giggled to herself as the shrieks of terror erupted from Ussopp and Chopper.

"DEMONS?! WE'RE GOING TO DIE!"The Marksman screamed as he and the tiny reindeer ran around each other in circles.

"Do not worry."Robin dismissed their fears with a wave of her hand."I'm very sure they will not harm you. You are the bravest warriors I have ever met, and I'm confident that they steer clear of you before I return."

She stood up and began walking towards the door of her room, her footsteps rocking their world and sending them a good few feet into the air with every punctuating stomp."I will be back soon!"She called out as she closed the door, almost to the point of laughing at the sight. Her microscopic friends thought her sandal was a whole other world, and in hindsight, it really was to them.

The Strawhats gazed about at their newest landscape, the air acrid with feet and the ground feeling strangely like leather, stretching out in all directions for miles, and a curious massive architectural arch overhead."So, what do we do now?"Franky asked, plopping his mechanical body down with a heavy thud."Sit tight, I suppose."Sanji replied, sitting down as well."I'm very sure our lovely Goddess will return with food fit for the gods themselves..."Sanji went into an almost day-dream like state, relishing the thoughts of the beautiful woman and partly for the food that he one day dreamed of cooking.

"....Anyone else hear that?"Luffy said absentmindedly, piquing the interest of his crewmates. A scritching, scratchy sound could be heard right underneath their feet."It sounds like...."

Before his sentence could even finish, he rolled back just as a massive form burrowed through the ground and landed before him, instinct and reactions saving the Captain."What...is that?"He cried a she gazed up at a massive monster that screeched at them in an air-shattering roar."D-d-demon....."Ussopp cried as he and Chopper took cover behind the largest of their crew, Franky, each of the Strawhats arming themselves for a conflict.

Meanwhile, Robin ordered the food, oblivious to the fact that her friends were fighting off a shoe weevil.
1513312112.title: Before the Food, Fighting

choices: Luffy goes to the plate, landing on a piece of food Robin is about to eat
15133121121.content:
THWIK!

Luffy crashed into the shell of the giant armored monster like a slingshot, his attack only enraging the beast further. For the past twenty minutes, the entirety of the Strawhats Crew, minus their archaeologist, had been fending off this beast, their attacks harmlessly bouncing off of it, they were simply too small to do any real physical harm."Where's that goddamned goddess?!"Zoro shouted as he attempted to stab one of his blades into one of the monster's many legs, only for it scrape against the shell with no puncture marks. Luffy, Sanji, Franky, and Chopper(in his heavy form) were assaulting the 'demon' with physical strikes, the only result in dazing the monster and keeping it from doing and real damage to them. Brooks and Zoro's blades would only leave small scratches, and Nami's Clima-Tact generated weather attacks that it only found annoying. Overall, they were screwed.

---

Robin walked in carrying a plate of meat, some exotic fruit, vegetables, a glass of grog, and a glass of water for herself. She set it down on a nearby table."Now, let's see how they're doing..."She chuckled to herself, walking over to the sandals where she had left the microscopic crew, surprised to see a tiny bug being assault by the group of dust mites she called friends."Oh my..."She held a hand to her mouth to stifle a laugh. It was almost...entertaining to see them struggle like that. The tiniest of insects proved to be a fierce challenge for them. It made her realize just how insignificant and helpless they really were. Their entire world and lives were in her hand and whims. She was their goddess, in a sense. Shaking her head, Robin pushed those thoughts to the back of her head. Despite their pathetically tiny size, they were still her friends, and she would have to help return them to their proper size eventually. But for now, she had a role to continue...

She reached down and with just her thumb, pressed it against the sandal's flat, squishing the bug effortlessly."Is everyone alright?"She whispered, wiping the remains of the squashed terror from her thumb.

"I'm so glad you came along! We almost died!"Ussopp wailed, tears literally streaming down his face.

"Tch. We almost had it too."Zoro sheathed his three katanas, only to get a good whack in the back of the head from Nami."What our swordsman hear meant was...thank you, Goddess."She added, not wishing to anger such a giant being for her aid.

Robin allowed a laugh to pass."I'm betting you all want that food now?"

"YES! FOOD!"Luffy cried out in victory as Robin lowered her finger, a wall of skin, and in a minute's time the shrunken pirates had climbed onto the pad of skin. Robin lifted them up and set them down on the nearby table, and once they were all safely off of her finger, she sat herself down at the table as well, plucking off a piece of the meat and dumping it in front of the specks, along with a crumb of fruit and vegetables and well. As with everything they had been the past few hours, they were in awe.

Each crumb was a mountain to them in it's own right, towering to the sky.

"A...a mountain of food...."Luffy's mouth stretched wide up, a river of saliva rushing out of his jaw.

"Well, go ahead, don't be shy. Dig in!"Robin said as she took a knife and cut off a square of meat for herself from the rest of the steak. With glee the specks each went to the three mountains, digging in joyously."Oh, almost forgot..."Robin went on. She dipped a finger into the bottle of grog, and with a little droplet dangling from her nail, set it down next to the speck she thought was Zoro."I heard you rather liked your alcohol, so this is for you...."

"T...thank you!"Zoro replied, shocked as the ocean of golden-brown liquid before him. He would never have to be sober again.
15133121121.title: Feast Fit for the Gods

choices: The Deep Valley of her Cleavage
Further down, the paradise of her crotch
151331211212.content:
Robin looked to her own plate of food with a bit of satisfaction. slowly eating her own portions of food slowly, savoring the food. Sure, it wasn't exactly culinary genius, but it had a hint of refined, old-timey flavor you would only find on a small island that they were on. It pleased the 'goddess' greatly."Now, my little worshipers,"She continued as she took a small bite of the meat."Once our meal is done, I am to rest. You may all safely reside upon me if you wish."She allowed a small grin to creep onto her lips. The idea of having the microscopic crew cared for by a single body part gave her a pleasing sense of power. But, she had to be careful. They were her friends after all, and she could only take the game so far. maybe in the morning she would reveal that she was no divine deity, only truly massive to the pitifully minute pirates. Then they would laugh, and she would find a way to return them to their normal stature. All she had to do was keep a close on them all...

---

Luffy only ignored her thunderous words, the only though in his mind was to shove more and more of the mountainous chunk of meat before him into her bottomless stomach. His rubbery skin would expand as he took bigger and bigger bites, but despite his efforts, there was barely even a dent shown in the crumb. Still, he was utterly happy. This was his paradise, a nearly-infinite amount of meat to consume. As he shoved the handfuls of the delicacy down his gullet, the naive captain took to looking around and examine how his crew was faring. Nami was daintily having her fill of the fruit, while Ussopp and Chopper had taken to running around the massive food like a game was in play. He would have to join them later. Brook didn't seem to be eating, and Franky was gorging himself on the food as much as the captain was. The massive metal man required subsistence as well. Sanji seemed to be poking at his own food, as it weren't palatable. He was always picky if the food was not prepared by him. Lastly, Luffy could only make out Zoro swimming in the ocean of grog, switching between gulping in the alcohol and going to the surface to take in gasps of air. He would definitely be drunk for the remainder of the night.

His attention eventually came to the woman who towered overhead into a massive blur. If he was at a distance far, far away, he'd be able to fully make her out, but being so close to the gargantuan being only gave him glimpses of what she truly looked like. Oddly, even in her blurry state, the Sea Goddess kinda reminded him of his missing crewmate Robin. But that couldn't be right. With a sigh and another gulp of meat, Luffy contemplatively worried for her. Where could their archaeologist be? Surely she didn't fall off the boat? A sense of worry came upon him. She was a devil-fruit user just like him, and she'd sink like a rock if she ever came in contact with the sea's salty grip.

"Uhh....Miss Sea Goddess?"Luffy shouted up, the massive woman's head tilting in his direction at the small whisper of his words.

"What is it, Captain?"She asked in a musingly playful tone, leaning against the table with her elbow and bringing her face closer to hear him, her beautiful features becoming his entire sky. A massive eye that replaced the sun gazed down at him.

"Since you're the goddess of the sea...and everything...did our friend Robin fall into your water? I'm really worried about her."

"Oh...."

Robin quickly searched for a reply. She thought she wouldn't have to explain the case of the missing archaeologist to the specks she called friends. Another quick lie would have to be made."No, dear Luffy, she hasn't. But if she did, I promise that I would not have allowed her to drown. She is a precious member of your notorious crew."

"Thank you, Sea Goddess! I was really worried about her for a moment!"

She smiled and felt touched for the concern for her. It left a warm feeling inside as they all continued their meal.

Unknown to Robin, however, Luffy had shot himself like a slingshot towards her plate, his mite-sized self invisible to her unfocused eyes as he switched landscapes from a wooden table to a ceramic plate, even larger continents of food shooting up around him. He had hoped to speak with her more, but it seemed she couldn't exactly hear him unless he was shouting at the top of his lungs and she was focusing dead on him. The size difference was truly uncanny.

"Sea Goddess!"He shouted once more, only for her to mind her own business and continue eating the world around him.

"Heeeeey! I'm down here!"He begin hopping up and down, waving his arms as well to get the desired effect of being noticed. Still no dice, and even her giant fork came only inches away from him, the massive metal object crashing into the ground and picking up a country-sized piece of food in it's leaving."Hey! You almost hit me!"Luffy shouted, getting a tad irritated now."C'mon, you could hear me earlier!"He took in a deep breath and shouted even louder, not even gaining a bit of the giantess's attention. Unfortunately for him, her fork came down much faster than he could anticipate, giving the object was so large. It crashed directly overhead, the tinges of the fork massive overhanging arches that shook the very world he stood up, and bringing it up as well. Luffy stumbled to the ground as it along with him was raised higher and higher, their destination the gaping hole that was the sea goddess's mouth. Luffy tried stretching his arms and slingshot himself away as before, but the size difference was much too vast. He only few a couple miles, which to Robin was barely a centimeter of length. Past her full lips he went into the darkness of her mouth, the dank and humid air filling his lungs and the stench of her breath overpowering his senses. In a flash his entire view became a wild and rampant roller-coaster that wouldn't stop.

He smacked in between chunks of food, his rubber body sending him richocheting around like a pinball, occasionally smacking into her gumline or far into her mountainous taste buds below. The worst fate came when he saw a sky of white coming down upon him like a meteor, and Luffy found himself being painfully ground up in her molars, Robin chewing away without a thought to the tiny pirate in her mouth, munching his body like bubblegum.

"Oh..."Luffy moaned as waves of pain cam upon him."Oh...oh shit!"His reactions saved him from another mashing as he narrowly rolled off of her bottom molar into the pink below, resting himself at the very base of her mouth. He could make out the opening of her jaw, a precious source of light so far away, but manageable for one such as the future king of the pirates. He bent at his knees and placed his fist on the ground, taking in a deep breath before exclaiming "Gear....Second!"

His skin took on a pinkish tone as steam rose off of his body rapidly. All that food he just ate would greatly come in handy.

He took off like a blur, his body moving at hyper-fast speeds, avoiding globules of saliva and massive pieces of various foods. In less than three minutes time Luffy shot out of her mouth, falling through empty air now. He looked up to see not a sea goddess, but Robin's towering face quickly falling and becoming higher and higher. Inverting himself in mid-air, Luffy could see that he was quickly falling towards...
151331211212.title: Accidental Chewing Gum

choices: Follow Robin as she continues to toy with the Straw Hats
1513312112121.content:
They were two endless plains of tan skin. Miles upon miles of flawlessly smooth skin, each a mountain in their own right. Even Luffy could recognize those shapes for what they were. He was falling right between Robin's breasts. Adrenaline quickly started pumping in the Captain's rubber veins as he gained a large grin. The realization this Sea Goddess was in fact his friend Robin removed any possible danger from the situation. She would never let her friends get hurt. Knowing this, Luffy let out a hearty laugh.

"Yeah!!!! Can't wait to tell everyone that Robin's a Goddess!!"

Luffy's rubber hand reached as far as it could to grab his friend's bosom to stop his fall. His fingers pushed roughly against her supple skin but the fingers couldn't get a hold of anything. It was too soft and squishy for Luffy to grab, especially at his size. Quickly realizing the futility of it Luffy pulled his hands back and looked to where he was falling. To him it was a canyon at least a mile or two wide with two sensual mountains on either side, but in reality Robin's cleavage was barely half an inch wide. Though still far more than enough for the rubber man to fall deep into the abyss.

Luffy would have fallen past Robin's chest and even further down if not for his luck. Just within his reach was his friend's bra strap. It gave just the means for the Captain to stop his descent and swing himself onto it. He stood atop the thin wire between his friend's breasts, looking up. He could no longer see Robin's face. All there was this dark chasm formed by her chest. It was like staring directly into an ominous cave in the sky. "Sounds like fun!" Luffy grinned at the thought. "Gomu Gomu...." Luffy wrapped his hands around the strap and pulled himself back, "Rocket!" Releasing so he could fling himself upwards like a slingshot.

----

"Mmmm" Robin licked away the final crumbs of her meal. "That was delectable." Her eyes turned to her crew, all of whom seemed more than satisfied. At least as far as she could tell. She couldn't be certain given their sizes. "You all enjoy your meal Mortals?"

"Yeah!" Came the reply in unison.

"I wonder where Luffy went though." Usopp looked around.

"I hope I didn't accidentally eat him." Robin smiled.

"Don't joke like that..." Usopp shuddered.

"Who said I was joking?" Robin's eyes grew mischievous as she lowered her face, "I rather think you all would make an excellent desert for this meal. In fact..." Robin poked her tongue against the table before her friends, mere inches away though notably farther to them. "I would suggest you run." Those were her last words before her tongue began to gently roll along the table towards her friends, barely moving, but going leagues faster than anything any of the Straw Hat's could hope to beat. In mere seconds her tongue would completely overtake them.

"I knew we couldn't trust her!!" Usopp's shrill voice was filled with the familiar terror she expected.

"I'm too pretty to die!!!"

"But...But I can't swim!!! I'm all bone no muscle Yohohoho!"

"This is no time for jokes!!"

The terror the Straw Hat's had as they ran just gave Robin incentive to go faster. She wouldn't hurt them. She'd just...rough em up a little. If she just happened to enjoy it then oh well.

I really am enjoying this too much. The Goddess mused to herself. One by one she felt them, minuscule specks barely registering on her tongue but she felt each of them succumb to the appendage. In the end even the almighty Straw Hats were nothing against Robin's tongue. Stifling a soft chuckle Robin rolled her tongue back into her mouth, gently swaying her shrunken friends inside. She was being as nice as she could but no doubt to them it was one of the most grueling and fierce experiences they ever had. Even Robin's breathing blew them aside like the bugs they were. Her breathing alone dominated their fates.

For safety's sake though Robin quickly spat out everyone onto her empty plate. "Pardon the rough housing but being a Goddess can get boring sometimes. So I often feel the need for excitement."

"If you think for one second that we will buy that then you have another thi-"

"Of course my darling Goddess! Anything for you my dear!"

Robin smiled, "Thank you Sanji. I think I'll take you on that..."
1513312112121.title: The Deep Valley of Robin's Cleavage

choices: The Strawhats...somehow get off the plate in time
They all latch onto the fabric strands of her shirt to keep from getting crushed
15133121121211.content:
Robin smiled, eyeing the more than minute specks down on her plate, no doubt gazing up to her titanically towering frame. As a little teasing joke, she hefted her breasts up to rest on the table, pressing against the plate the small Strawhats stood on. To the microscopic pirates, every action of the 'Sea Goddess' created earth-quaking rumbles and explosive booms that no doubt would cause hearing damage. Her monumental breasts appeared simply as a neverending wall before them, Sanji already nosebleeding and worshiping at the sight of it.

The archaeologist giggled to herself, leaning against the table, chest pressing closer towards the plate, pushing a bit of cleavage out of the top of the thin fabric. She was just...having too much fun being a goddess right now. Perhaps she would postpone telling them the truth. Truly, what was the harm in it? As long as she kept an eye on them all, and didn't have 'too much' fun, she could always revert them back to normal size somehow. There was always something out that could fix there problem, whether it be some mystical artifact, a power that be, or even another devil fruit user.

If not, well...Robin paused to think of what would happen if she could not return her tiny friends to their former statures. What would become of their voyage? No doubt Luffy could become Pirate King if a speck of dust was bigger than him, as well for the others. She supposed she could simply continue the farce as Sea Goddess for as long as she could, maybe get a droplet of water in her cleavage and let the Thousand Sunny float around in it as a false ocean, or possibly come clean to them and keep them all as tiny companions.

She giggled at the thought of all of them as little pets, used for her to call them cute and to toy with for her amusement. She'd most certainly take care of them to the best of her abilities, how hard could it be? A crumb food was a whole mountain to them, a droplet of water an ocean. They even had their ship to lay their heads down in every night, so sleeping and shelter would be no problem.

"Umm...Goddess?" Nami called up as loudly as she could, interrupting her thoughts. Robin blinked a bit, looking down. It seemed she had gotten lost in thought, and was gazing ahead at the wall in front of her.

"Yes....what is it, speck?" She asked, coughing to deepen her voice and taken on her 'goddess' tone once again, no doubt lowering it sending ear-splitting thunder booms with every syllable of her words and a windstorm with every inhale and exhale of her breath.

"You just....sat there for a few minutes."

"I was thinking." The black-haired beauty replied quickly. "Of what to do, that is. You all did agree to lighten my mood and entertain me for a while." She giggled lightly.

"We'd do anything for you! Myself especially." The chef called up so giddily, most of his fellow crewmates simply too tired with his actions to knock him over the head.

"Hmm..." Robin tapped her chin thoughtfully. "Start running again." She said in a tone that obviously meant her words as a command not to be denied. At once the strawhats took off in the opposite direction from her godlike visage, dashing across the landscape of the ceramic plate. Sanji and Zoro took the lead with their much more advanced stamina and speed, Chopper quickly behind in his jumping point self, Ussopp not too far behind as well, a coward's fear and speed helping him in a panic. Nami and Brook were somewhere in between speeds, and Franky lumbered behind due to his mechanical form, but keeping a pretty steady pace.

Though, to Robin above, it looked like they weren't even moving at all.

She stifled a chuckle. "Really? Are you all even trying?" She asked, raising her hand over the plate and hovering a finger like a sign of doom over the near-microscopic pirates trying their hardest to run. "Or are you mortals so tiny to me that not even the greatest of speeds could outmatch my size?" Nico Robin giggled, slowly lowering her finger, the sky above simply flesh etched with the canyons of her fingerprint lines.

After a few minutes, Robin merely rolled her eyes and finally slammed her finger down onto the plate, her nail making a light scratch noise against it. Fortunately, the small strawhats had made just enough distance to avoid ending up neath the appendage, though the boom and shattering earthquake generated from Robin just tapping the plate knocked them all off their feet.

"Hmm, perhaps we need something more...challenging to you Strawhats." The false goddess mused.

"What could be more challenging than avoiding a finger as big as a continent?!" Ussopp cried up between his panting breaths.

"Avoiding a breast the size of a continent." Robin said, rearing her upper torso upwards so that her right breast was positioned just so over the plate, casting a dark shadow for countless miles. "I believe you all know what to do." She said quite happily, though a bit of menace in her tone. Robin mentally smiled to herself. She wouldn't actually lower her breast all the way down, that would no doubt end her friends. She'd just...tease them. Perhaps later she could hover her pinky toe over them, or even allow them a chance to explore her like a world itself? She smirked, imagining giving Nami an order to start mapping her body. She could just see them exploring the inside of her ear, while cleaning out ear wax, or them trekking across the soft fields of one of her butt cheeks, or the vast jungle of a few strands of her hair.

She'd definitely be keeping up this little game for a while.
15133121121211.title: Toying With the Tiny Pirates

choices: She goes on with the idea of them exploring her body and mapping it
Robin actually decides to head into town and find a way to fix them
151331211212112.content:
Slowly, ever so slowly, every actions of hers no matter how minute, was vast and powerful to the tiny micros below, so Robin lowered her breast at an agonizingly slow pace to relish every moment. She chuckled at the thought, just the simple action of her mammary mushing into the plate powerful enough to easily reduce them to microscopic paste at a whim's notice. But she wouldn't do that, no, she'd hover it and slowly bring it down for a minute or two, then bring it back up to continue whatever game she could think of next. This all was so entertaining.

Overhead, the sky of Robin's chest seemed to loom ominously, growing closer and closer by the second, and no matter how fast they could run, the Strawhats knew that they couldn't outrun something and powerful as a goddess's tit.

"We're all doomed! We're gonna be crushed!" Ussopp screeched in fear.

"Speak for yourself! I'm gonna love going out like this!" Sanji cackled so happily.

"Oh shut up loverboy..." Nami sighed, she would love to hit him right about now if he wasn't so far ahead of her.

"Yohohohoho! I would much rather end my life in her panties!"

The Strawhats merely shouted in fear or jokingly at one another as Robin's boob only descended more and more towards them, now close enough that some parts of the soft flesh was meeting the plate landscape, making powerful booms in the distance that only gave them more incentive to run faster, but even these endurance monsters had their limits, and it seemed they all would be reaching an end soon.

Soon, instead of just a massive, sky-filling blur, her ever-increasing breast began to take definite form above. The tinies could actually make out the roundness of it, the swell, the sheer size and softness, even the fabric thread lines of her clothing. At this, their local green-haired swordsman paused, getting an idea. "Oi! Everyone follow me!" He shouted, readying himself as the breast seemed to come crashing down around them, so close to crushing.

"What?! I'm not gonna follow you!" Sanji retorted.

"Shut up and actually listen to me for a moment!" Zoro said back through gritted teeth. He definitely did not want to argue right about now. He looked at his fellow crewmates and pointed up to a nearby loose strand of fabric, one that was hanging off of the Sea Goddess's top close enough for them to grab onto, and hopefully even avoid getting boob-crushed.

All of their eyes lit up in realization at this, and at once began to ready themselves to head for it. Zoro, Sanji, and Chopper were the first to leap up the great distance and latch onto it, Franky giving Ussopp, Nami, and Brook a good toss up there for them to grab on. The cyborg himself, well, let's just say it involve cola bubbles and his inflating ass to shoot up there.

Once they were all safely onboard the fabric strand, they all seemed to sigh in relief. Zoro raised an eyebrow at Sanji, frowning. "I thought you wanted to get crushed by the Sea Goddess."

"No," Sanji dismissed the swordsman casually with a puff of smoke from his near-constant cigarette. "This way, I can worship her more." The cook chuckled, pointing upwards. High above, their sky was still pretty much boob, but in a different way. Through strands of clothing fabric, all so big and the distance between them unreal, a sky of soft pink greeted them, Robin's vast country-sized nipple poking past the shirt and bra fabric. "Ahh, so beautiful." Sanji sighed in admiration, flicking away his used cigarette and allowing one last stream of smoke to escape his lips along with his happiness.

"..."

"..."

"...Whatever." Zoro sighed.

"Well, least we're safe now." Nami sighed, sitting down onto the large fabric strand, it being thick enough to easily house a platoon of ships.

"Yeah, but fer how long?" Franky asked the real question.

Robin had gotten lost in thought once again, smiling to herself, breast fully pressing down onto the plate dreamily. She was thinking of letting the tiny microbes cleaning food from in-between the white mountains of her teeth, massaging with all their might just a fraction of her sole, even exploring the vast, vast cavern of her womanhood. She cooed in delight, but blinked and quickly realized what was going up. In a panic she reared back up, looking down at the plate, eyes scanning intently.

She couldn't find anything, so sign or sight of her microscopic mates. "Ohh..." She grimaced, wondering if she had actually crushed her friends in her daydream. In her search, her eyes roved frantically over the plate, and even her own chest. Finally, she saw some tiny, tiny movement right near the edge of where her nipple was. On further inspection, she found it to be the micro-pirates. The raven-haired woman sighed in great relief, using her nail to retrieve them.

"Good. You...survived my test. Congratulations!" She said, trying to hold back her tone of worry.

"We almost got crushed!"

"Almost."

"..."

"Now, you all will receive a reward..."
151331211212112.title: The Sea Goddess's Games

choices: Nami states her dissasatisfaction to the goddess
They still have more places to explore and worship
1513312112121121.content:
Now that she knew her friends were safely on her nail and not squished somewhere on the vastness of her chest, she coughed, striking up her godly tone once more. She could now continue her fun little games, and the Sea Goddess was not done yet toying with these pitiful mortals.

"This little reward is quite a...large one." Robin giggled a bit, sending a volley of powerful breaths their way, nearly blowing them right off the edge of her nail. "As a goddess, I own many a realms, ranging from the sea itself to many others. Myself is a realm included."

"...Huh?"

"Yes, indeed, for one so godlike and vast, I am an uncharted realm all my own."

"Did you say...uncharted?" Nami piqued curiously, her navigator senses tingling a bit. Her hand itched, and she knew she would have a chance at drawing new maps soon to places nobody else has been before. Sure, it wasn't a god's fortune in gold and jewels, but it was the next best thing for her, literally a 'god' as a wolrd, unexplored and unconquered.

"I don't like where this is going..." Ussopp whined.

"I do!" Sanji cackled happily.

"Nami has a strange look in her eye." Chopper observed.

"But first, allow me to help you retrieve some supplies." Robin stated, walking back over to the pair of sandals she had placed the Strawhats on before when she went to go retrieve some good. Just as were, the infinitesimal speck of the Thousand Sunny was still there, resting on the bed of her footwear. She smiled, lowering her nail slowly and as gently as possible, setting them all down near the small ship.

"Gather as much as you want. I will return in a few minutes so that you may begin your trek...across me. It's sure to be a grand adventure." She smirked with a light chuckle, standing back up to her full height, looming so high above even the word 'big' could hardly describe her titanic stature, putting anything else considered a large size to shame. She then walked off, every earth-shattering step sending the tiny pirates a few inches into the air, until she disappeared, no doubt into another realm.

They all climbed aboard their ship, glad to be in familiar surroundings, each of them heading to their respective rooms for at least a moment's reprieve of rest. Nami smiled, browsing through her own private collection of empty maps and drawing tools, hefting them all together into a satchel that Sanji would be carrying for her. She briefly looked over the empty room, one she shared with Robin, and still worried of just where their archaeologist, as well as their captain, had disappeared to.

Once they were all ready, stowed up with supplies in backpacks for the possible long road ahead, they all waited on the deck of the ship for the Sea Goddess to return.

Meanwhile, Robin smiled in the bathroom, slipping off her clothing piece by piece until she was fully in the nude once more. She thought that to keep an eye on her tiny little crewmates, she would need to be bare so see them, and clothes would simply get in the way. Plus, she laughed a bit at this thought, what need did a goddess have for clothes? With a sway of her hips, she strutted her divine form back towards her sandals lying on the ground, their tiny occupants awaiting her.

"I return, specks." Robin announced, slamming down her bare feet powerfully in front of the sandals, smiling and wondering just how near-cataclysmic those earthquakes to them below. "Now, are you ready for your adventure?" She asked, kneeling down and holding out her nail towards the ship, the small specks soon atop the edge of her manicured nail.

"Good." She stood back up, bringing her nail up to her eye to examine them. "Where would you like to go first?"

"Anywhere you desire, uh, my goddess." Nami replied, still eager to get on the Sea Goddess's good side.

"Hmmm..."

---

The Toe Mountains

The seven minute specks all walked along a desert landscape of flesh, the air humid however, and smelling of a combination of feet, sweat, but just a hint of lotion and oil. They were somewhere atop of Robin's big toe, avoiding falling into her toeprint lines that were almost like vast and deep canyons, occasionally running into the dirt speck or piece of lint, which they promptly removed due to the orders of the titanic goddess.

"Alright...not much to map here. Pretty much a barren land, hard to climb too." Nami noted, drawing more and more detailed notes on her map of the appendage, looking in the distance. Beyond the landscape of the toe, she could make out blurs in the distance wiggling, awaiting their mapping as well. The redhead sighed, pulling out four more maps for the 'Toe Mountains' as she had dubbed, despite the fact that they were larger and so much more vast than any mountain could ever be.

Perhaps Toe Country instead?

---

Nippleton

"AHHHHHH!"

"Would somebody please calm him down..."

"Oh let him be, Yohoho! He seems to be enjoying himself!"

Sanji's whole body was pressed into the soft pink landscape, furiously kissing it and groping about. Booming moans above from Robin only gave him more incentive to continue his exploits to the sensitive nipple, which was rumbling quite powerfully as it slowly became erect. Nami merely shrugged and rolled her eyes, sketching out various landmarks, like bumps in the skin and how the nipple seemed to create more of a landscape when it was erect.

---

Glutesberg

It was just...neverending. In every direction, all the eye could see was soft flesh one could worship eternally, which Sanji was at once again.

"...You're such an ass-kisser." Zoro muttered to the blonde chef, rolling his eyes.

"That's the point." Robin's thundering voice giggled in the distance, sending a wiggle to her rear as she laid on her stomach, nearly sending the pirates flying off or into the abyss of between her cheeks.

"Hmm...I dub this place, Glutesberg." Nami stated, finishing up another map. Most of them were actually empty besides a few notes. Everywhere they went it was just....so big, so vast, impossible to map unless she had years and years to do so, and Nami did not want to be spending her golden years into old age walking over this sea goddess. She was getting kind of tired of all of this.
1513312112121121.title: Exploring the Realm of the Goddess

choices: Robin meets the local elders to see if they know anything
Somebody enters Robin's room while she's away...
1513312112121122.content:
"Umm...Sea Goddess?"

"Oh? Oh, yes. What is it, mortal?" Robin coughed, having been lost in thought. With her friends safely onboard her nail and not squished by her vast chest, she had contemplated returning them to their normal sizes as quickly as possible now, negating any thoughts earlier of continuing to toy with them. Being so small, literally any part of her could crush them, and even the smallest of objects could pose as something deadly to them.

"You uh...seemed to drift off a bit there." Nami replied cautiously. "Are you okay?"

"Yes, I am quite fine." She dismissed Nami with a good boom of words. "I just...recalled that I have another realm to be in right now. Other gods to converse with, other mortals to speak to. A goddess is quite busy."

"But-"

"You all shall return to one of my realms and stay safely on your ship until I return. If you leave it, I shall be....most disappointed. Am I understood?" She said in as cold as a tone as possible to make herself threatening. It wasn't even needed, her ear-splitting volume was all they heard. Once she was certain they all agreed, Robin nodded down to them. "Good." She stated simply, setting them down on her sandal bed near the Thousand Sunny, waiting until the specks were on the slightly bigger speck ship.

With that, Robin was off to try and see what she could find out about any local legends or lore about shrinking storms. She made sure to lock the door behind her so no one else could get into her inn room, her key nestled safely in her cleavage.

Robin stepped out of the small inn she was currently residing in, the sky clear and the day sunny from the rain last night. A few of the villagers were out, and Robin nodded to herself. The historian and mythologist inside her buzzed, eager to see what she could pull up about the island. She first tried the marketplace, but nothing there that could help. Next, a bookshop, some local myths and legends were heard, but nothing on a storm that could shrink people down to microscopic heights.
1513312112121122.title: Finding a Solution

choices: Follow Robin as she searches for the micro village
Follow Luffy as he tries to get Robin's attention
15133121121211221.content:
Nico Robin sighed in defeat to herself, sitting herself down on a nearby bench overlooking a small garden in the village, lovely daisies and roses wafting their elegant scent over to her in the light midday breeze. Their colorful demeanor and lovely smell did nothing to improve her mood over the fact that she had failed as a researcher, something she prided herself in when it dealt with strange myths. Even the local library had no such thing in its records. To be fair though, the library was very small, and the island itself was tiny, not even on any current map. It was just by happenstance that the Strawhats had decided to dock at this unknown port town for the night.

"Think..." Robin muttered aloud to herself, leaning with her elbows propped up on her legs and her chin resting in the palm of her hand, using her pointer finger to tap her cheek in thought. No thought came to mind from the vast and many thoughts she had on various ancient topics of lore. Some did have many myths and legends about size-changing, but most were about giants becoming human sized or vice versa through a devil fruit, nothing on weather phenomena.

Perhaps...there was no true way to return her friends and crewmates to their normal statures. They could be fated to spend the rest of their days as microscopic mites, never again be able to do as what a normal-sized being could do. How would she break it to them? That their dreams could never happen? That they all would have to rely on her for nearly everything, from traveling and protection. She could only imagine how much a bruise to her more powerful crewmates egos it would be, that not even some of their strongest attacks could even tickle a child's country-sized pinkie toe.

Defeatedly she buried her face in her hands, long black hair draping over her in a cloak of shame. Robin felt terrible, as if the whole situation was her fault alone, despite the fact she could have easily been on the ship when it shrank as well. How would that have gone if she became small too? They would have just endlessly floated in the docking port's waters...occasionally hearing a distant boom, fighting off tiny crustaceans and fish, until eventually something so much vaster crushed them. What a terrible existence it would've been.

"..." She looked up, trying to get away from the horrid and depressing thoughts, eyes open again to the lovely, sunny day before her. She almost envied the townsfolk around her, wandering blissfully about their small village. Children played, bakers baked, fishers fished, mothers cared, and elders sat stoically, overlooking it all with old yet keen eyes.

That made Robin perk up. The village elders.

She quickly stood up and walked across the village's length to them all sitting on a porch in rickety chairs, three of them in total, all looking at her curiously as she approached. They were what one would expect from elders: frail-looking, hunched over, bearded and wizened. Perfect. Perhaps they would know something to aid in the re-enlargement of her friends.

"Good afternoon." Robin greeted with a small bow, placing a gentle smile on her lips.

"Hello young lady, what brings you to speak with old geezers like ourselves?" One chuckled dryly, having a coughing fit afterwards.

"I just...have some questions if you don't mind answering them."

"Not at all." Another shook his head. "It's our job to share knowledge. What ponders ya?"

"It's just...does this island get any strange weather?"

"Define strange, young lady. We live in a strange, strange world indeed." The third one grinned a toothless, gummy smile.

"Well...would thunder and lightning...and possibly rain...shrink something around here?"

All three grinned knowingly. "Why yes, it would dear. The Shrink Storms are very rare, and happen roughly two or three times a year, all in quick succession of one another. Why, just the other day we had one."

"I know. It shrank my friends and our ship."

"Good thing you weren't in it! Glad your nakama have you to take care of them, though they might have to get used to looking up and up and up...and up to you from now on."

"Is there no way to reverse it?" She asked, crossing her arms.

The elders shared a glance between themselves. "Not that we know of dear. In all of our old times, we have never encountered anything that would reverse the effects of the storm. What's shrunken, stays shrunken."

"...I don't believe that." Robin shook her head, refusing to come to grips with the situation. She and her crew had faced impossible odds before where it seemed there was no other way, and she would not stop now. That indomitable willpower of Luffy's had rubbed off on all of them.

"Sorry to say, but you have to-" One of the elders paused to see that another one of them raised his hand to quiet him. This one coughed before speaking.

"Well...you could always head more inland, to the other side of the island where the storms come from. Maybe the town on the other side can help you."

"Good." Robin nodded. "Where is it exactly on the island? Is there a path I can take?"

"Oh, you won't find it."

"...And why's that?"

"It's shrunken. Legend says they dabbled in terrible arts, angering the gods, so the shrink storm was there curse, reducing their own residence smaller than the eye could see, forever lost amongst towering blades of grass and insects as lumbering mountains, but the storm still originates from where the reduced lay."

"...Thank you for your help." Robin nodded, giving another bow before heading off in the opposite direction. She knew just what she had to do, find the shrunken village and see if any of them could help. She chuckled again, thinking of how small it would be, barely big enough to cover a fraction of her fingertip, then remembered...what if it had been crushed long ago? She hoped it still remained somewhere unharmed. It was really the only lead she had.

As she stopped by the local marketplace to purchase supplies, namely a magnifying glass and some food, Robin was unaware of a tiny, tiny red speck climbing into her ear canal after a long trek there, Monkey D. Luffy exhaustedly collapsing into a pile of yellow ear wax, not even caring how gross it was.
15133121121211221.title: Elder Knowledge

151331211212112211.content:
After gathering her supply's Robin headed out. If what the village elders said was true then there was at least a chance of restoring her friends back to normal size. With that said Robin began her search, luckily for her the island they were on was fairly small, besides the port and small town the rest of the island was mainly plains and small forests. But there in lied the problem, the island was small, the forest was small and the plains were small, but the shrunken village had to be near micro sized. If the Sunny was small enough to dock in a droplet of liquid then the village wouldn't even take up her entire finger tip.

Thus Robin began her looooooong search for something that might not even exist. She spent hours trekking along the plains and examining every blade of grass in the plain, luckily with her devil fruit power and her many magnifying glasses she was able to make much quicker work of what would take a normal person days, she accomplished it in a few hours. From the plain she moved onto the forest which was smaller than the plain but there were far more places to search. Taking a moment to herself Robin allowed her thoughts to wander from the task at hand to think about her crew. She had left them in her sandal by the foot of her bed, luckily before leaving Robin had made sure to send one of her flower-flower clones to the room to let them know that their "Sea- Goddess" would be away for a while and they were to wait patiently for her to return. Robin having been worried about another bug attack had placed the sandels on top of a box with insect repellent sprayed all around the area, she had also left them a few crumbs of food and a droplet of water and grogg so at the very least they should be confortable and safe til she returns. As much fun as being a sea goddess was Robin knew she had to return her friends to normal size, they would never survive in this world at their micro-size, hell they had almost been killed several times today, including by Robin herself! Robin had been relieved she hadn't crushed them with her breast but it was at that point she knew she could no longer have her friends suffer at such a diminiutive stature. Snapping back into reality Robin continued her search, creating hundreds of eyes and hands to search every inch of the forest with magnifying glasses Robin began her long search, Meanwhile...

Unbeknownst to Robin she was carrying a teeny-tiny passenger with her. A very special passenger, her captain Luffy. Luffy had managed to survive Robin's valley like cleavage and had begun his accent towards the beautiful goddess' ear, hoping he can get her attention somehow. Trying to climb whilst an extremely Titanic being is moving is one of the hardest things Luffy has ever had to do, every step, every slight movement, he'll every heart best from his gigantic crewmate made the journey more difficult. But Luffy was a resilient one, he relished the challenge and kept climbing Robin. He accented from her valley like cleavage and trekked up her enormous country like breasts, Sanji would be jealous at what Luffy was doing had he any knowledge, but to Luffy this was all one extremely big adventure! Hours passed and eventually Luffy reached Halfway between Robins ear and her shoulder with himself hanging onto her hair and trying to cling on whilst also positioning himself to try and reach the summit of his climb, Robin's ear. "Man this has been longest journey ever! I can't wait to tell Robin all about it when it get up there!!!" Luffy proclaimed happy as can be. With one final action he switched to gear second and launched himself from Robins hair all the way to her hair, he must have travellled a fair few miles as the journey took several minutes before he landed in the canal on Robins ear.

Meanwhile Robin sat down on a tree stump exhausted from her day of searching for the village. She began thinking to herself that all this had bene a waste of time and that the village if it had even existed was long gone, crushed by a falling twig or eaten by a hungry bird. She would have to make a decision, whether she should tell her fiends or their predicament or simply continue the ruse as their sea Goddess and let them continue their journey with her pulling all the strings and fabricating reality. Robin actually felt sad at this notion, her friends would never fulfill their goals an Robin would never fulfill hers, they neeeded each other and they needed to all be normal sized. With one final sigh of despair Robin stood back up and prepared to Head back to the village and make a tough decision, Luffy meanwhile prepared to shout as loud as he could to get his friends attention but just before he could he was interrupted.

"Those who search for the truth, approach now and have all your questions answered"

Robin stopped dead in her tracks and turned around. There was no one there. "Did I imagine that? Or did someone call out to me?" thought Robin. Once again the voice rang out.

"Those who search the Truth, approach now and have all your questions answered."

This time Robin knew she had heard it. "Hello? Is anyone there? I wish to know the truth!" Robin had no idea who or what it was but she had to try, maybe there was someone out there who could help them. After a few seconds silence Robin heard the voice speak again.

"Very well, you may approach"

Robin stood there confused. "Approach?" She said as she looked in every direction, only to see the forest, "what do they me..." Robin trailed off as just to the left of her beside the tree stump she had been sitting, shone a bright blue light that was almost blinding. In her ear Luffy was also blinded by the light and panicked as Robin began moving again. He was tossed about in her ear banging odd the sides before landing a patch of ear wax. "Yuck, If I make it through this I'm gonna let Robin know about this!"

After several moments the light stopped and Robin approached the source. Crouching down she would just about make out a small speck under a small leaf, taking out her magnifying glass she lowered herself down even further to the point her face was almost touching the ground, she let out a small gasp. There under her magnifying glass was a tiny village with lights, houses and people who were staring up at her. This was it she had found the shrunken village that had caused the shrinking in the first place.
151331211212112211.title: Micro search
